column1: Dana Kilborne is the President and CEO of Cypress Bank & Trust Company.  She led the charter conversion of 25-year old, Palm Beach based Cypress Trust Company to Cypress Bank & Trust, expanding to include full service banking in August 2021 with 4 bank and trust branches and 2 trust branches across Florida.  Ms. Kilborne began her thirty-five year banking career in South Florida before moving to Central Florida in 2000 and splits her time between both markets. Cypress Bank is her second de novo bank. Ms. Kilborne currently serves as a Director of NCMIC Insurance Company, Des Moines, Iowa, Florida Institute of Technology and HealthFirst Inc., an Integrated Delivery Network, both based in Melbourne, Florida. She is a former Director of the Federal Reserve Bank Board of Atlanta-Jacksonville Branch. Ms. Kilborne has served on the board of many community organizations and has served as Chairperson of Space Coast Economic Development Commission; and Holy Trinity Episcopal Academy.
column32: Dana published a thesis entitled "Mergers and Acquisitions Handbook for the Community Banker."
column69: Cypress Bank & Trust offers full service bank and trust branches in Palm Beach, Vero Beach, Jacksonville and Melbourne; trust offices in Naples and Winter Haven with additional representation in Sarasota. The company has been managing wealth and preserving legacies since its founding in Palm Beach in 1996. For more information, please visit www.cypressbanktrust.com.

column1:
I worked as a business manager for 15 years in a private utility company that served a 3800 customer base. In 2004, after earning my Bachelor of Science in Accounting from St. Leo University, I began my own company, Total CFO, LLC. I am now a business manager, accountant and personal representative for several high wealth individuals. 

I manage the personal financial matters, hires all ancillary staff and services required, arranges all travel, coordinates the pilots, food service and trips for my clients’ personal aircraft, and supervises the small businesses owned by them. I oversee the accounting, payroll, benefits and daily management of my client’s businesses. 

I am considered the “go to” person between my clients and the management of their business investments and am integral in the final business and financial decisions.

Specialties: Office management, accounting, customer service, sales and public relations in the hospitality, utilities, construction, and real estate fields.

column1:
I founded Aberdeen Advisors in 2009 because I went through the process of building, owning, and selling a business. It was very confusing at times. My goal was to create a company that simplifies a very complex process and helps business owners get top dollar for their profitable business. 

Aberdeen Advisors specializes in selling companies based in the Southeast with revenues of $5 million to $100 million. 

I’m an experienced deal maker, having advised hundreds of sellers and connected them with qualified buyers. My strengths lie in using my industry connections and drawing on my personal experience to make the best deal possible for all parties. Aberdeen Advisors uses a proven 6-step process to sell a business for the most money, while getting the best terms and conditions with the fastest closing date. 

My book, Turn Your Blood, Sweat & Tears Into Cash: A Guide to Sell Your Business is a comprehensive guide that covers everything from pre-sale preparations to what to expect during the process. It describes both mechanisms for success and common pitfalls to avoid. Easy to understand, it includes real-life examples. Profitable business owners who want to sell their business for top dollar will find this book to be a valuable resource.

I am also a featured speaker, offering insight to CEOs and business owners who are passionate about their companies. My presentations include “The 7 Deadliest Mistakes When Selling a Business” “Is Now The Right Time To Sell?” and “Maximize the Value of Your Business.”

If you own a profitable business that you are considering selling, contact me at emery@aberdeenadvisors.com and let’s talk about how Aberdeen Advisors can streamline the process while getting you the most money for your business.
column69:
It is a privilege to work with our team of experts and the clients who trust us. We are known for selling great businesses for great people!

Building a business is not something everyone has the opportunity to do in their lifetime. For those who do, it’s exhilarating, stressful, profound and usually the culmination of endless hours and commitment. We respect your accomplishment and look to position you for a profitable transition or exit.

Founded in 2009, Aberdeen Advisors, Inc. is a Mergers & Acquisition firm that specializes in helping business owners sell their profitable businesses.

Awards & Recognition
#1 TOP Producer in 2012 in the Tampa Bay market for Total Dollar Sales of Businesses by BBF

column424:
THE ONLY GUIDE YOU NEED TO SELL YOUR BUSINESS FOR MAXIMUM VALUE
You have built your business from the ground up and you are finally ready to sell, but you are facing three major problems:

-You don’t know enough qualified buyers that will pay what your company is worth.
-You do not have the expertise to negotiate the complexities of a business sale.
-You are so busy running your business, you do not have the time required to properly market, negotiate and handle all the required due diligence.

Turn Your Blood, Sweat & Tears into Cash is a comprehensive guidebook, covering everything from pre-sale preparations, to what you can expect during the process, and skillfully describing both mechanisms for success and common pitfalls to avoid.

Presented in an easy-to-understand manner and illustrated with real-life examples, this book is a valuable resource for profitable business owners who wish to sell their business for top-dollar.

By the end of this book, you will have a clear understanding on how to successfully navigate the sales process to ensure you receive maximum value for your business.
column427: Turn Your Blood, Sweat & Tears Into Cash

column611:
Selling your business is a complex process. Many business owners wonder if they're even ready to sell, while others are concerned about finding the right buyer that meets their goals.

If you're a business owner curious about the selling process, join me for an Executive Round Table on March 7 at 10 a.m. EST. We will discuss how business owners can maximize a sale, how to prepare their business for the due diligence process, and how they can reach their selling goals. 

I look forward to seeing new and familiar faces and providing insight into how business owners can achieve a successful exit this year.

#mergersandacquisitions #businessowners #sellingyourbusiness
column626:
While various economic factors influence the current M&A outlook, that doesn't mean there isn't room for opportunity for business owners and buyers alike. 

Our latest article highlights some of the opportunities that business owners and buyers could take advantage of while waiting on the market to return to a more steady state. 

If you're thinking about selling your business in 2023, I highly recommend capitalizing on some of the opportunities mentioned in this article and leveraging a trusted Advisor Team to help guide you to reach and maximize your business goals.

#businessowners #mergersandacquisitions #businessopportunities
column641:
Our latest article highlights some of the key factors that will have the largest impact on mergers and acquisitions dealmaking in the coming months, including inflation and interest rates.

Having an advising team you trust on your side will help navigate the complexities of selling and the changing market. Check out our latest article for more on these variables and how the Aberdeen Advisors, Inc. Kurt has over 35 years of transactional and operational experience in multiple industries. He has closed more than 75 transactions representing well in excess of $1 Billion in transaction value, many in healthcare or construction, while providing strategic guidance and transactional services to FRG’s clients. 

Kurt’s previous background includes strategic planning at a major bank holding company, real estate securities syndication, construction management, head of a healthcare practice transition consulting group, and president of several dental practice management companies, both public and private.

Twice a graduate of The University of Michigan, Kurt holds an MBA as well as a BGS with dual concentrations in Ancient History and Computer Science.  Kurt currently holds a Michigan Builder’s license   as well as the FINRA Series 62 (Corporate Securities), Series 63 (Uniform Securities Agent State Law), Series 82 (Private Securities Offerings), and Series 79 (Investment Banking) securities registrations.

column69:
Money House Reverse is a Wholesale Only Direct Reverse Mortgage Lender.

As one of the most highly decorated mortgage banking companies in Puerto Rico, Money House is now earning that same trust from our Broker clients in our US mainland markets.

OUR MISSION
•	Handle every loan with honesty and integrity
•	Work closely with Mortgage Originators on Reverse Mortgage Refinance and Purchase loans
•	Provide a “right fit” to our Broker Partners so they can provide their Borrower with the Right options
•	Keep seniors in their homes
•	Help seniors and their families live financially secure lives
•	Provide education and expertise to support our Broker Partners to assist the Borrower in making the right mortgage transaction decisions

OUR COMMITMENT
Money House is committed to families. Why is that important? Because we are a family. As a family-owned business, Money House understands the sensitivity that comes with making big family decisions—like a reverse mortgage.
By committing our best efforts to our Broker Partners, we not only focus on providing exceptional, personalized service to each and every one of our clients—we do so with transparency and a sincere interest in their particular situation.
We pride ourselves in being a fully approved and authorized HUD/FHA Mortgagee, Ginnie Mae issuer of forward (MBS) and reverse (HMBS) mortgage loan securities as well as a servicer of our loans in many cases.
That’s why we do not answer to investors. And why we only answer to our clients and  customers.

OUR TEAM
For nearly 25 years, we have built our reputation on honesty and integrity with our customers and partners alike. Our dedicated teams in Puerto Rico and now, the United States, allow us to provide exceptional service to help our Broker Partners make the best decision possible — for their brokerage and their client's family and financial future.

Have been spent the last 6 years building and leading the Mid-Size Bank Coalition of America.

The Coalition is the only financial services industry group whose sole purpose it is to singularly, energetically, and effectively represent mid-size banks within the overall banking industry, and to educate lawmakers about the financial regulatory issues and policies that uniquely affect the ability of mid-size banks to compete fairly and to more fully support and contribute to the growth of the U.S. economy. The MBCA’s effectiveness is rooted in the direct engagement of its member CEOs and their senior executives teams.

column450: August 4, 2021, Brent managed James directly
column453:
I have known Jim for 8 years from when he first became a member of the Mid-sized Bank Collation of America (MBCA) representing TCF bank as its Chief Risk Officer.  (MBCA is a trade and professional association of 100+  US banks ranging in size from approx. $10Bn to $100Bn in assets). 

What struck me when I first met Jim was his fluid command of the myriad of issues facing midsize banks.  In the context of the MBCA, Jim’s interaction with his peer CROs and CCOs quickly evolved into one of mentor, as he was always generous with his time + willing to assist bankers navigate the most challenging regulatory and balance sheet risk management issues their banks were facing, many of whom were just beginning to mature those disciplines.

Further, Jim was an essential and important voice on numerous legislative lobbying trips to DC and an effective champion for the interests of midsize banks in front of the Nation’s top regulators and key Congressional Members. 

During these meetings Jim’s understanding of the critical role midsize banks played in facilitating the post-Great Recession economic recovery was evident as he convincingly advocated on behalf of his industry.  Jim’s arguments to Washington policymakers were compelling.

My relationship with Jim over the years has continued to grow as he has become a go-to-resource for the MBCA, acting as a sounding board for many MBCA-member bank stakeholders. 

Jim’s judgement is exceptional, his knowledge of the industry is broad, and his pragmatic approach to complex problem solving is exemplary. 

I am fortunate to count on Jim as a partner and hold him in high regard.

Brent  Tjarks
MBCA Executive Director

column239:
The M&A Advisor, renowned globally for its recognition and presentation of leading M&A, financing
and turnaround professionals, created this recognition awards program to promote mentorship and
professional development amongst the emerging leaders of our industry.

“The Annual M&A Advisor Emerging Leaders Awards was born as the 40 Under 40 Awards in the
United States in 2010 to recognize and celebrate the achievements of young M&A, Financing and
Turnaround professionals who had reached a significant level of success and made a notable
contribution to their industry and community. With the expansion of the Emerging Leaders program to
the United Kingdom, and Europe in 2016, the 2017 US award winners join a truly global network of
outstanding young professionals,” said David Fergusson, President and Co-CEO of The M&A
Advisor.

The 2017 Award Winners have been chosen from a pool of prominent nominees for their notable
accomplishments in business and in service to the community.

Evaluation and selection of the nominees was completed by an independent judging panel.

Added Fergusson, “It is our belief that the Emerging Leader Award winners will continue to have a
significant effect on the advancement of our industry. Through the support of business, philanthropic,
academic and personal development experts, we are establishing a connected “leadership
community” with the mandate to empower these successful young professionals to improve the life
experiences of others through their career.”
http://www.maadvisor.com/EL/2017-EL/2017_Emerging_Leaders_Winners_Press_Release.pdf

We possess specialized software development skills, including creative, agile design methodologies, scalable and secure deployments, PCI/HIPAA compliance expertise. We have deep executive management and development talent and pride ourselves on client partnerships and “listening closely” to the needs of the marketplace as we work to solve problems for better solutions, outcomes, and bottom-line results.

column1:
As the founder of CB Capital Advisory, Chris leverages his expertise and passion for working with companies to provide innovative solutions and insights that help his clients achieve their goals.  Chris is known for his collaborative approach, attention to detail, and unwavering commitment to his clients' success. Whether he is working with a start-up or a successfully scaled company, Chris is dedicated to helping his clients reach their objectives and build a brighter future.

Prior to founding CB Capital Advisory, Chris spent 26 years in various roles at several Wall Street firms, including Cowen & Company, Bank of America, and JMP Securities. In addition to his Institutional Capital Markets functions and product management role he co-founded and led the Family Office Group at JMP, where he developed a large network of substantial family office investors specifically engaged for their direct investment activity in the private and public markets.

Securities offered through Finalis Securities LLC Member FINRA/SIPC. CB Capital Advisory LLC and Finalis Securities LLC are separate, unaffiliated entities.  Christopher Barkauskas is a Registered Representative of Finalis Securities LLC Member FINRA/SIPC.

column1:
I lead two companies that help businesses make smarter, faster decisions—with data at the center of both.

At Dark Sky Data (www.darkskydata.com), we help VSC and home warranty marketers and administrators, lenders, and private equity firms turn messy spreadsheets into instant insight. Our tools transform raw data into time-aligned visuals that show what’s working, where margin is leaking, and how customer behavior unfolds over time. Whether you’re tracking cancellations, paydown curves, or marketing response, we help you get answers fast—no models, no formulas, no IT.

As CEO and Managing Director of Colonnade Advisors (www.coladv.com), I lead a specialized investment bank focused on mergers and acquisitions in the business and financial services industries. Over the years, we’ve completed nearly $11 billion in M&A transactions, representing founders, private equity firms, and strategic buyers. We bring deep sector expertise, trusted relationships, and a steady hand to every stage of the deal process.

What connects both companies is a clear mission: to help executives uncover the signal in the noise—and act with confidence.

If you’re exploring a sale, analyzing your data, or just trying to make better decisions with the information you already have, let’s talk.
column58: The University of Chicago Booth School of Business

column1:
Joshua Orlinsky is the Chairman and CEO of Equiturn Holdings, Inc., a global investment banking platform operating at the intersection of public and private capital markets, institutional advisory, and high-impact transaction execution. Under his leadership, Equiturn has scaled into a multi-entity financial group, delivering complex M&A advisory, strategic capital placement, and multi-stage transformation for middle market leaders, upper middle market corporations, and large-cap enterprises worldwide.

Orlinsky directs the firm’s portfolio of subsidiaries, including Zeno Citium Global Securities, Equiturn Sports and Entertainment Capital, MJ Toro Global Securities, Equiturn Business Solutions, and Equiturn Alpha, each purpose-built to deliver specialized financial services across regulated and non-regulated verticals. At the core of his strategic vision is the modernization of investment banking through deal successes, AI-driven intelligence, vertically integrated platforms, cross-border capital deployment, and marquee deal execution.

He is the architect of the firm’s proprietary GTE, QLC, PSC, SDSU, PST, ECURM, DTX, POD, and INFL models, each engineered to systematize execution, compress transaction timelines, and institutionalize value creation. Together, these frameworks represent a new era of financial advisory, one rooted in precision and scalability.

With deep experience across deal origination, capital markets structuring, and institutional relationship management, Orlinsky has led and structured some of the most high-profile deals in the world, with transactions spanning technology, engineering, sports, entertainment, commodities, infrastructure, real estate, staffing, government contracting, banking, and more. He is widely recognized for building high-performance teams that execute with the precision and cadence at the highest level of investment banking.

Orlinsky holds FINRA Series 63 and 79 licenses and is leading Equiturn’s continued global expansion, with current offices in Miami, New York, Las Vegas, Fort Lauderdale, and Boston, and imminent offices planned this year in London and Dubai.

column69:
Equiturn Holdings, Inc. is a global financial services platform delivering investment banking, strategic financial advisory, and capital markets solutions through a network of specialized subsidiaries. Equiturn partners with corporations, financial institutions, global powerhouse entities, UHNWI, and family offices, providing tailored guidance to drive transformative growth, maximize value, and execute complex financial transactions with precision.

Zeno Citium Global Securities, LLC

The core of Equiturn’s investment banking operations, specializing in ultra high profile hyper-complex transactions across M&A, equity capital markets, and structured financing. ZCG executes high-stakes capital raises, private placements, and securities transactions with unmatched expertise.

Equiturn Business Solutions, Inc.

A leading provider of non-regulated strategic financial services, including growth management consulting, M&A advisory, operational efficiency optimization, and pre-IPO preparation for middle-market firms.

MJ Toro Global Securities, LLC

Merging regulated and non-regulated investment banking, MJ Toro delivers large-scale M&A, primary and secondary offerings, and equity capital markets expertise, helping companies execute transformative market strategies.

Equiturn Alpha, LLC

The investment advisory and asset management arm, providing portfolio management, structured investments, and alternative asset strategies for HNWIs, family offices, and institutions, leveraging quantitative models and proprietary insights to drive superior returns.

Equiturn Sports & Entertainment Capital LLC

A specialized investment banking division focused on sports finance, offering debt/equity capital solutions, franchise acquisitions, stadium financing, and media rights monetization, driving capital efficiency in the professional sports industry.

Equiturn Holdings continues to expand its global footprint, positioning itself as a dominant force in investment banking.

column626:
A defining moment for the platform.

After executing with relentless focus, passion, drive, and persistence, with now over 200 open deals and scaling transaction flow into the hundreds of billions, we are proud to announce that Equiturn has formally launched its Foundational Institutional #capital raise.

This is the only time primary #equity participation will be offered ahead of our next phase: full platform monetization, fund architecture activation, and global capital markets expansion.

We are now raising up to $250 million in aggregate commitments from a select group of partners, with no minimum investment requirement. This capital round is reserved for those who see what we see: the convergence of velocity, infrastructure, and institutional credibility.

This isn’t capital for growth. It’s capital to institutionalize a legacy.

Equiturn’s platform today spans an integrated ecosystem of operating entities, each built for precision execution across regulated and non-regulated verticals:

▪️Zeno Citium Global Securities
▪️MJ Toro Global Securities
▪️Equiturn Sports & Entertainment Capital
▪️Equiturn Alpha
▪️Equiturn Asset Management 
▪️Equiturn Business Solutions
▪️Equiturn Air
▪️Equiturn Mega Alpha Fund I
▪️EQ+R Alpha Fund I 

Our footprint includes New York, Miami, Boston, Fort Lauderdale, and Las Vegas, with London, Dubai, Amsterdam, and Monaco next to activate.

To the sovereign allocators, family offices, HNWI/UHNWI, and institutional funds who’ve watched this platform emerge and asked when the right entry point might come: 

This is the inflection.

If you are a qualified investor and would like to learn more, please message me directly.

This post is for informational purposes only and does not constitute an offer to sell or the solicitation of an offer to buy securities. Formal offering materials are available solely to qualified parties upon request and subject to appropriate documentation.
column641:
Introducing Equiturn Sports & Entertainment Capital 

At Equiturn, every transaction is more than just a deal - it’s a life-changing moment. Behind every placement, M&A transaction, and structured financing, there’s a founder realizing their life’s work, a company securing its future, and families gaining the financial stability to build a better tomorrow.

For us, this isn’t just investment banking. It’s a mission.

That mission has propelled us to hundreds of billions in capital placement deal flow, proving that impact and scale are not mutually exclusive. And now, we’re bringing that same disruptive, high-performance ethos to the sports and entertainment industry.

Equiturn Sports & Entertainment Capital – Changing the Game

With the launch of Equiturn Sports & Entertainment Capital, headquartered in Las Vegas under the leadership of Marcus Banks, we are redefining the financial landscape for professional teams, leagues, and media empires.

Backed by a syndicate of tier-one capital partners - including leading institutions, ultra-high-net-worth individuals (UHNWI), multi-family offices (MFOs), family offices (FOs), and sovereign wealth funds - we are delivering unmatched capital access and groundbreaking deal structuring in one of the fastest-growing financial sectors in the world.

And we’re already breaking records - actively working on the behalf of ~25 professional sports enterprises across 14 leagues, financing 5 feature films, and partnering with some of the largest music empires on the planet - all with an average IOI turnaround of ~1 week.

From stadium financings and franchise acquisitions to media rights securitization and athlete wealth structuring, we’re executing unprecedented deals that traditional banks can’t touch. This is investment banking at the highest level - where financial strategy meets cultural impact, and where we don’t just move capital - we shape the future of global sports and entertainment.

🔹 Bigger. Smarter. Faster.
🔹 The future of sports finance is here.
🔹 Welcome to Equiturn Sports & Entertainment Capital.

#InvestmentBanking #SportsFinance #PrivateEquity #Equiturn #CapitalMarkets #SportsBusiness #Finance #MergersAndAcquisitions
column654:
Equiturn and I just won first place at the 2025 #FSU100. Looking back all these years to get to this personal milestone, the journey was never about waiting for the perfect moment. It was about showing up every single day, pushing to the absolute limits of sanity, and being delusional enough to believe we could make it work no matter what.  That kind of belief - unyielding, relentless, and aggressively tiring, is what now turns some of my smaller dreams into a reality.

You have to believe in yourself in the best of times, but also in the darkest of times, because that is what creates the brightest of moments. And for me, this one will serve as just that. 

Congrats to my fellow #FSU100 2025 class. I have a feeling this is the beginning of a very big month.

column424: Businesses that excel across the majority of these areas receive top dollar when they sell. To truly understand the value of your business, hire an advisor that fully comprehends the marketplace in which you operate. True – your general accountant could probably get the job done for you, but if you’re going to pay for a professional service and you plan to base life-changing decisions upon it, you should get the most informed analysis available. Call an advisor that understands valuations within the context of the current pricing climate for your industry.

column667:
Happy to share the latest Momentum Advisory Partners' Q4 2024 Staffing Industry M&A Activity Report! 2024 was another challenging year for the staffing industry, and unsurprisingly, M&A activity mirrored the broader market's struggles. Despite these challenges, the industry saw over 100 completed transactions, a testament to the resilience and adaptability of market participants.

Sentiment among those we speak with regularly feels cautiously optimistic heading into 2025. However, until the staffing industry shows meaningful signs of a rebound, a significant increase in M&A activity may have to wait.

column1:
With over 33 years of experience in consumer and business banking, I am a results-driven executive adept at developing and executing effective strategies. Since beginning my credit union career, I have enhanced member experiences by improving online and mobile banking systems, streamlining the loan process, and boosting employee engagement. My leadership transformed our credit union, turning a negative ROA into a positive one. I engage regularly with State and Federal Representatives to promote and protect the small credit union movement. As a graduate of the National Credit Union Foundation’s Credit Union Development Education (DE) Training, I am committed to the credit union movement, funding a scholarship for others to attend the training. I have served as President of the League of Southeastern Credit Union Gulf Coast Chapter and continue as a board chairman. I served on the CUNA Mutual Select Credit Union Council 2022-2024 and as a board member for CU South.
 I deeply believe in the credit union slogan "people serving people," and this was powerfully illustrated when a Category 5 hurricane devastated our local communities. My leadership allowed us to provide critical services and support to our members and neighbors during the crisis, demonstrating the true spirit of our mission. At CLCU, we are dedicated to making a positive impact, and I am proud to be part of this incredible journey.

column1:
I started Dynasty Financial Partners for one simple reason, to improve the financial advisor model by building a service platform that allows advisors to do more for clients, grow their business more efficiently, and minimize conflict.

For advisors considering owning their own RIA, the road to independence and business ownership does not have to involve sleepless nights or fear. For advisors who currently run their own RIA but want to grow their business’s efficiency through outsourcing, Dynasty provides solutions to streamline virtually all aspects of their business. Dynasty, along with the Dynasty Network and resource partners, offers a unique and powerful community that promotes collaborating, partnering, investing in proprietary technology, sharing of best practices, unique access and scale that benefits all Network firms and their clients.

At Dynasty, we get to live our American Dream by empowering others to live theirs! It is our great honor to service our network of clients. Please feel free to contact me directly to learn more about Dynasty and our Network of truly exceptional independent advisors.
column32: Activities and societies: Captain Bates Baseball Team
column69:
Dynasty Financial Partners works exclusively with a select group of truly independent advisors of integrity to help them better serve their clients while ultimately growing their business and enterprise value. We are the industry advocate for advisors and accomplish this through aligned business interests with our Network Partners, a shared set of values that drive a connected Community, and a common vision to be forward looking leaders within the wealth management industry and advocates for the advancement of financial education and literacy across the country. 

With the power of our people, processes, partners and platform, their businesses have the potential to run more profitably and grow faster. We offer access to flexible capital solutions to help advisors develop, expand, and scale their business. We also provide M&A support to firms looking to grow inorganically or to plan for succession. Through a strategic and cultural partnership that we foster with each of our Network firms, we seek to enhance their enterprise value and accelerate their growth. We accomplish this through our proprietary core service model that provides middle and back office support in the areas of Finance, Technology, Marketing, Compliance, Practice Management, Investments, Consulting and Community. 

Headquartered in St. Petersburg, Florida, and with four offices across the country, the Dynasty team powers the industry’s most rewarding opportunity for entrepreneurial independent advisors of integrity.

Visit our website for more information: www.dynastyfinancialpartners.com
column104: The Finance Leaders Fellowship Program seeks to develop the next generation of responsible, community-spirited leaders in the global finance industry. This new, two-year program is modeled on the Henry Crown Fellowship which was established in 1996. Using the Aspen Institute method of text-based dialogue, and building upon the Institute’s commitment to values-based, action-oriented leadership, the program will spur selected Finance “Fellows” to consider values and perspectives necessary for effective, enlightened leadership in finance—and in society at-large.

column1:
Born & raised in Northwest Ohio, Braun Mortgage Group founders - Greg & Cameo Braun, were looking for a change of scenery.  With two young children and a growing aversion to cold winters, they decided to venture to warmer climates and made the move to Sarasota, Florida, in the summer of 2014.  Armed with over a decade and and half of experience in the mortgage industry and a ton of tenacity, the quest to build a new business from the ground up began!  With a focus on personal attention, Braun Mortgage Group has built a strong network of Real Estate Agents, clients & referral partners – all while sharing knowledge, compassion, enthusiasm & a dedication to improving along the way.

At Braun Mortgage Group, we believe in challenging what has become the lending process standard. We believe that obtaining a mortgage loan should be a smooth, transparent & pleasant part of the home buying process. We believe in educating our clients and informing everyone involved throughout the process, ensuring that every question is answered, and every detail is understood.

Our family is our passion.  Our mission is to extend the essence of family into our brand.

I was the executive producer for my rock band's album which I played drums for and was the lead singer. We turned a profit 3 times over with cassette tape sales (pre-internet days).

Braun Mortgage Group is a family-owned mortgage brokerage based in beautiful Southwest Florida, founded by husband-and-wife duo Greg and Cameo Braun. With over 20 years of experience, BMG brings true family values and a refreshing human touch to home lending.

🏡 Personalized Service – From start to finish, BMG prioritizes clear communication, transparency, and education for clients and partners
🔍 Competitive Loan Solutions – With access to a wide network of lenders and decades of experience, BMG delivers competitive, customized lending options and smooth closings
💻 Seamless Digital Experience – Secure online applications, digital document delivery, and 100% in-house processing make the entire process easy and stress-free for all parties involved

With a 5.0-star average across 100+ reviews, clients consistently praise BMG’s accessibility, trustworthiness, and reliable service.

We proudly serve families across Florida with one simple mission:

For a mortgage experience that feels like home,
work with a team that treats you like family.
column104:
Braun Media Group is an award-winning, family-owned media company that creates music, podcasts, and published works that inspire, connect, and empower.

We exist to tell powerful stories, fuel personal growth, and encourage others to go for their dreams.

He has a CAMS certification and is a member of the Board of Directors at Acelera International Custodian Bank, FIBA, and AMLFC Institute.

He helps financial institutions meet their compliance goals and reporting requirements efficiently and effectively, by leveraging his expertise in financial reporting automation, data resource maximization, and strategic planning. column453:
Georgiana ran the financial show for Wolters Kluwer in the Americas.  She was about keeping the books straight, from budgeting and forecasting to ensuring all the numbers added up.  She also nailed those month-end closing tasks, which were spot on.  Plus, she built some pretty cool tools to track expenses and determine how much recurring revenue was coming in, making everything easier to manage and predict.

Georgiana didn't stop there; she also worked on making hiring smoother and tracking who was getting paid what in sales commissions.  And if that wasn't enough, she was also in charge of planning the finances for all 24 of Wolters Kluwer's offices around the globe.  So, she had a significant role and was super important in ensuring everything ran smoothly and efficiently on the money side.  She was key to keeping the finances on track and helping the team make intelligent decisions.

She was always there to help and was one of the best workers I have worked with at Wolter Kluwer!

column461:
In 1989, I joined a company called IDOM, where I was the President and CFO.  IDOM was growing in helping banks with projects and developing software.  By 1998, we realized we needed a person to run Human Services as we could not handle the increased load of priorities.  We need someone with the knowledge to set up and run the Human Resources department properly, create policies and procedures, and take care of payroll, reviews, and all the required tasks that HR would handle.

After interviewing many individuals, we hired Tom Hachtel to take on the job.  He set up the entire process of maintaining the payroll, developing personnel procedures, creating an employee handbook, and employee reviews.  With him, we gained as my business partner, and my background was more focused on accounting and operations as a former banker.  Our goal was to get business.

Tom did a fabulous job, and when he relocated out of New Jersey, even though we were sad he was leaving, his procedures and quality of work helped us find someone who could follow in his footsteps. We always stayed in touch, and we are still in touch.  

If anyone wants a review of Tom, you can find me on LinkedIn. I would be proud and happy to tell you what a great guy and businessman he is!

column104:
Since 1986, Ippolito Christon uses the “Free Cash Flow” method of valuing companies and brands.  Beverage industry franchisors, large distributors, sophisticated investors, and lenders use the same or similar method to equate the present value of an enterprise to its projected cash flows.  Analyzing future prospects, not just historical results, we stay current with industry trends and benchmarks to prepare a credible valuation based on a multi-year projection of cash flow.

For 36 years, the firm has worked as exclusive financial advisor for clients of all major brands, performing over 700 engagements nationwide for closely-held beer, wine, and spirits distributors and soft drink beverage companies

Hired to be the full-time Information Security Officer of a bank under a Consent Order for Information Security, BSA and ACH violations.  Responsible for the re-development and implementing of a new InfoSec Program that would clear all 25 points including violations of law of the FDIC placed Consent Order.  
•	Consent order lifted within 14 months of issuance with all points being addressed.
•	Developed the business plan to migrate the secondary VMware® cluster out of state to better protect the bank’s network infrastructure.  The net cost was zero to the bank over a five year period and increased the network bandwidth and provided nearly 100% redundancy.
•	Developed functional and understandable risk assessments, vendor due diligence and user access control monitoring.
•	Developed meaningful reports for the Board and IT Steering Committee to communicate Information Security and Technology performance.

I build what doesn’t exist, scale what’s stuck, and lead teams through growth that lasts.

As a founder, operator, lending and fintech executive, I’ve launched ventures, revived struggling teams, and architected strategies that have driven billions in loan originations and millions in revenue. From AI-powered automation to high-growth SaaS platforms, I bring a rare blend of entrepreneurial instinct, operational discipline, and product innovation.

Whether in a startup or enterprise environment, my focus is the same:
Identify high-impact opportunities. Build the strategy. Execute relentlessly. Scale fast and smart.

- Founded and sold a SaaS lending platform acquired by an Inc. 500 company

- Built the first AI chatbot trained on SBA SOP + credit policy

- Led a company through 8x growth during the pandemic, earning top workplace honors

I'm currently the COO of a fast-growing business lending platform, while also serving as Founder and CEO of multiple ventures in AI and fintech. I thrive where others hesitate, at the intersection of ambiguity, innovation, and execution.

column1:
Korth Direct Mortgage’s is a commercial real estate finance company and mortgage bank. We currently manage approximately $500mm of commercial real estate debt and specialize in complex CRE financing, transitional  and bridge multi-family, stabilized small balance multi-family, and all types of owner-user financings. Our Mortgage Secured Notes program does single-asset first lien securitizations via the public debt markets. We specialize in $2-$50 million multi-tenant property refinancing. KDM is a vertically integrated mortgage bank, originating, lending, servicing, and securitzing our own commercial mortgage loans on cash flowing properties.

KDM Capital Partners is our flagship fund that provides returns to investors by investing in KDM's loans and CRE transactions.

J W Korth & Company is a boutique fixed income firm that specializes in asset management and brokerage for small Institutional Investors, Trusts, Registered Investment Advisors, and very high net worth individuals. Through the combination of our broad market reach and deep knowledge of every sector of the fixed income marketplace we bring unparalleled value to our clients' portfolios, whether those are corporate trust departments, individual investors, or money managers.

2011, 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022 Top Women-Led Business by The Commonwealth Institute

Deposits can be placed into either Certificates of Deposits, Money Market accounts, or a combination of both. 

Our goals is to provide our clients with a balance of current income & capital preservation, as well as obtaining liquidity for the many banks  that we have relationships with throughout the country. 

We are a family led business with various backgrounds of fixed income expertise.

Responsible for overseeing the Enterprise Risk Management Framework. Ensure independent oversight and guidance for managing risk across the institution, helping to develop and implement measures that protect the Bank’s interests while ensuring compliance with regulatory standards.  Leads a team of risk and compliance professionals that play a critical role in fostering a strong risk management culture, ensuring that every employee understands the importance of managing risk to deliver responsible growth, serve customers, and support local communities.

Utilize work experience that has provided a comprehensive understanding of the financial services industry and the critical importance of managing risk at every level. 

Maintains Certified Regulatory Compliance Manager (CRCM) and Certified Enterprise Risk Professional (CERP) designations.

In addition to her role at Citizens First Bank,  serves as a Director for the SunCoast Bankers Compliance Association and is a member of the Florida Bankers Association (FBA) Banker Education Council, further contributing her knowledge and experience to the banking industry. Passionate about supporting others and understanding the rationale behind decisions, believes most important role in position is to act as an advisor. Dedicated to building and nurturing relationships that contribute to the development and success of a strong, sustainable risk management program.
column104: Joined Alarion Bank in July 2005 as the VP/Compliance, BSA and CRA Officer. Responsible for overseeing the BSA program, ensuring that the Bank stayed abreast of changing banking regulations and regulatory guidance and acting as an advisor and assistant to Department Managers in establishing and maintaining the Bank’s policies and procedures in compliance with regulatory guidance, with compliance training of Bank staff.  Chair of the Bank’s Compliance Committee.  Also, responsible for compiling Exam Letter Request documentation for State, FDIC and external examiners, meeting with examiner and/or auditors to discuss the Bank’s policies and practices related to BSA and Compliance functions, as well as reviewing and responding to reports issued as a result of the exams and/or audits conducted.   In December 2006 added responsibilities for overseeing deposit operations staff and day-to-day back office operations functions.  Administer the Bank’s deposit core systems daily maintenance/upgrades/conversions.  Handle annual IRS reporting, deposit compliance and policy training and implementation, assist with branch operations oversight to ensure employees understand and are adhering to Bank and Regulatory policies/ procedures and properly completing day-to-day responsibilities.   Chair of the Bank’s Operations Committee.  In July 2010 transitioned to current role as VP/BSA Officer and HR Coordinator responsible for formulating and directing policies regarding recruitment, promotion, compensation, employee benefits, the Bank’s training program, managing personnel files, provide guidance to managers and employees, upholding employee-employer relationships. Key member of Cross Sell Committee, Compliance Committee and Technology Committee.  Certified BSA/AML Professional.
column139: Develop, implement and oversee bank-wide BSA Program, ensuring policies and procedures meet regulatory requirements, monitoring customer account activity and documenting results for suspicious activity and money-laundering, auditing branch performance with requirements, train all staff to ensure understanding and ability to perform job responsibilities in accordance with regulatory guidelines. Developed and implemented the banks Deposit Operations Department.  Worked with core processor to develop operational policies and procedures, provided training to tellers, new account representatives, and accounting staff, implemented regulatory requirements related to deposit laws and regulations to ensure compliance and ran day-to-day bank operations supervising 7 staff members.  Lead the startup and management of a full spectrum of HR operations, systems and programs. Worked with directors and senior management to create HR policies and procedures; recruit employees; create group benefits databases; and develop orientation, training and incentive programs. Manage leave-of-absence programs and personnel records; administer benefits enrollment and programs; administer HR budget; and handle HR generalist workplace issues.

column1:
My career path was a unique one, leading me from big corporate America on Wall Street to the transition of entrepreneurship, having founded several credit card processing companies.  In the late ‘80s/early ‘90s, I worked at Lehman Brothers’ Investment Banking Group; my landmark project was selling the iconic Rockefeller Center in Manhattan. Although my time on Wall Street was successful, I desired more — specifically, to become an entrepreneur.   

While working 80-100 hours a week, I created Spectoculars, a paper folding binocular.  The NFL purchased 250,000 units for Super Bowl XXX which was the launch of my first venture.

Charge Card Systems (CCS), my first payments company, grew to over 500 sales agents with regional offices throughout the USA.  In 2012, the business was sold to Card Connect.  Following the sale, I continued as president of our division and, in 2017, the company was acquired by First Data for $750 million.

Today, I have a great management team to help manage my different payment processing companies and in 2024,  I’m very excited with the launch of our new company FamVault.

In addition to my payments career, I enjoy public speaking and writing - I have  written and published six business books, including “Size Doesn’t Matter – Why Small Business is BIG Business" which hit #1 on Amazon's bestseller list in the entrepreneur and business categories.

column139:
FamVault is revolutionizing how families organize, access, and share their most important documents—whether for everyday needs or during life’s critical moments. From wills and trusts to medical records and financial plans, our platform makes it easy to securely store, manage, and share essential information when it matters most with the passing of a loved one. With advanced security measures like blockchain technology and 24/7 cybersecurity, we ensure unparalleled protection and transparency.

I’m proud to be part of a team that is making such a meaningful impact and excited to contribute to its growth.
column169:
Alternative Merchant Processing (“AMP”), provides credit card processing solutions for hard-to-place and high-risk businesses. 

With over 20 years of payment processing experience, AMP has banking relationships in the USA and overseas that understand the underwriting and risk profiles to approve hard-to-place merchants.

The industry of high-risk merchant processing continues to change and evolve within the payments ecosphere. Companies that were once considered traditional merchants are now considered high risk. Credit card payment processing companies are facing significant challenges with their risk underwriting and credit risk managers' need to determine which merchants to accept.

Numerous features include accepting payments, job scheduling, push notifications, GPS tracking and much more.   Visit www.toolboxpayment.com

column1:
After 35 years of innovation in global infrastructure investment, I am a visionary in impact investment, creating abundance for diverse communities. For over thirty years, I have worked as an investment banker, specializing in designing long-term capital structures for infrastructure projects in emerging markets. My portfolio includes various asset classes such as transportation, logistics, telecommunications, utilities, energy, oil & gas, mining, and industrial sectors. Additionally, I have expertise in social infrastructure, including health, education, justice, social housing, and sports & entertainment. 

I defied convention by skillfully combining interdisciplinary tools such as selective stakeholder involvement, strategic risk management, credit enhancement instruments, and financial guarantee engineering. Through this approach, I consistently discovered investment opportunities with the growth potential typical of emerging markets, but with significantly reduced risk. 

Over the past decade, I have transformed my focus towards a new and revolutionary approach, impact investment, through GIA. This innovative strategy is based on the belief that infrastructure investment should serve two purposes: generating economic gain and fostering social and environmental prosperity. 

With my extensive background, I have redefined financial structures to maximize their impact on the communities they serve. This has involved transforming traditional business models to be more efficient and effective. My mantra is simple yet profound: minimal cost and maximum impact. This focus on efficiency embodies the success of my vision and marks a promising pathway forward for the investment world, as well as for global prosperity as a whole.

#investment #socialimpact #leadershipdevelopment #infrastructureinvestment #sustainableinfrastructure

column1:
Sandra Zervoudakis is an industry expert in the behavioral health market. She has worked as an operator of numerous hospitals and behavioral health treatment facilities, including ones owned/operated by HCA, Psychiatric Solutions and UHS. Sandra completed her graduate degree in mental health counseling at Nova Southeastern University and subsequently began her work in the substance abuse and mental health profession. 
Sandra held executive titles of CEO, Executive Director, COO, and Senior Director of various behavioral health treatment facilities. Sandra has owned and operated her own facility, which she built from inception to a stable, operational state and ultimately sold it. Sandra has led complete reorganizations to multiple large and small facilities to re-staff and restructure to obtain profitability. Sandra has been involved in setting up innovative systems in behavioral health facilities. Over the course of her career not only have these systems been successful but have set some of the standards for best practice in both inpatient, outpatient settings. 
Most recently, Sandra has transitioned to an M&A advisory role, providing sell side representation, strategic planning, and valuations with an emphasis in behavioral health care. 
Sandra has continued her work in healthcare as an appointed patient care ombudsman for the United States Bankruptcy Court in the state of Florida, as well as an advisor to multiple consultancy boards.

column1:
Each day I look forward to leading our group at Instant Financial to assure we are strengthening relationships and improving the lives for those we serve.  I consider each day a good day if we have done our best to understand our clients and communicate the value we can provide through creative solutions to challenges faced by businesses, while improving access for employees within those businesses. 

I have been fortunate during my career to be involved with innovative people and businesses that have developed solutions which have improved the lives of millions employees across several thousand clients.  We developed a team that first transformed payment access by creating the first payroll debit card for employees who were still receiving paper checks, and who did not have access to the valued banking and digital payments environment.  Novel at the time, this enabled employers to move to 100% direct deposit for the first time, while assuring employees had free access to electronic payments.  Some of my most meaningful business and personal relationships were built, as we were developing the path to electronic pay.

Today, I lead the team at Instant to assure we deliver another solution that positively transforms the business environment for our employers and provides each employee access to their wages at no cost, when they want it, where they want it and how they want it.  In all that I do, I seek to create opportunities for may family, friends, clients, partners and business associates so that in some way, we create a better day for all.

My focus on our Instant team and our clients is based on many of the leadership tenets I learned during my time as a pilot in the United States Marine Corps.  We always seek responsibility and accept responsibility for our actions.  We trust, but verify the details that impact our clients, and we always seek to serve those who depend on us for our pay, before our selves.

column1:
Lee M. Eisenberg started in the mortgage business back in 1979 in Wilmington Delaware where as Vice President he ran production branches for Margaretten & Co. a national mortgage banker.
In addition to being top production loan officer from 1979 to 1990 he was also responsible for training local realtors on FHA, VA & Conventional financing at the Board of Real Estate.  The Veterans Affairs in Philadelphia appointed him their main contact for veterans that were stationed at the Dover Air Force Base for all matters concerning mortgage financing.  For many years he also spoke at first time home buyer seminars throughout the state.  In 1987 Lee served as President of the Delaware Mortgage Bankers Association. 

In 1987 Lee took an opportunity to take over an existing branch for Margaretten in Pittsburgh for two years, and then in 1989 another opportunity with Margaretten transferred him to Boca Raton Florida.

In 1994 He opened First Town Mortgage in Boca Raton

In 1997 Lee formed Leading Edge Mortgage Corp. a licensed Mortgage Brokerage approved with the State of Florida & Texas as well as Federal House Administration (FHA) & the Veterans Administration (VA).

Specialties: FHA/VA & CONVENTIONAL MORTGAGES
Jumbo Financing, 1st & 2nd Mortgages
First Time Buyer mortgages

RainMaker Group Holdings ("RGH") is a holding company of advisory businesses relating to the business of private equity. RGH is the owner of three businesses:

(1) RainMaker Securities ("RMS") is a merchant bank providing financial advisory services to emerging growth issuers of private equity and debt. RainMaker is a licensed general securities Broker/Dealer in the United States, and a FINRA/SIPC member firm. RMS operates in 24 states and advised on 177 private securities transactions in 2015.

(2) RainMaker Asia Holdings ("RAH") is a Hong Kong based advisory firm focused on providing financial advisory to Asia-based private issuers.

(3) RainMaker Ventures ("RMV") is a fund vehicle with a mandate to make investments, on both a primary and secondary basis,  in exceptional late stage private investment opportunities.

It has been a learning experience and very rewarding to have known and worked with Glen over the past eight years. I have learned a lot about the world of investment banking and corporate strategy, all of which will serve me well throughout the decades to come.

Glen is one of those rare individuals who has the analytic capabilities and management talent to build successful businesses -- both for his clients, partners, and for himself.  A hard-working, tireless, and relentless professional with the absolute dedication to "getting it done," he gets the best performance from others (including me) by delivering it himself.

When it comes to investment insight and the ability to rapidly "read" a business, he had a clarity of vision that enable him to advise and direct his clients -- and importantly, to know when to steer clear of those looking to become a portfolio company.  His knowledge of industry areas spans a wide range from fintech to consumer, from marketing analytics to CPG -- and in the few areas Glen might be unfamiliar with an aspect of a business, he always knows where to go to get the answers.  Effectively and efficiently.

To close, it is not only the business attributes that make Glen an exceptional person.  He is also one of the most honest and honorable people I know.

Selected Career Achievements:

We are investment bankers who help asset and wealth management firms maximize long-term value.

Like other bankers, we help clients with liquidity options, succession plans, and capital raises. column424:
Revenue-Based Funding (RBF) is a financing model that allows businesses to raise capital by agreeing to share a percentage of their future revenues with investors until a predetermined amount, often a multiple of the original funding, is repaid. Unlike traditional loans or equity financing, RBF doesn't require giving up ownership of the company, and it’s typically based on the company’s revenue performance, rather than its creditworthiness or the ownership structure.
RBF is particularly popular among growth-stage businesses, especially those with predictable and recurring revenue streams, like SaaS (Software as a Service) companies, e-commerce, and subscription-based businesses.
column427: The Ultimate Guide to Revenue-Based Funding

column1: With a long history of experience in the online transaction processing business; I, along with my partners, have put together a vast array of solutions, contacts, and knowledge to create a complete consulting asset for online merchants, banks and processors.
column69:
ISC FRAUDefender is one of only a few Certified Visa Merchant Purchase Inquiry (VMPI) Facilitators that actually connect directly to the Visa Resolve Online system. Basically it's a system that all issuing and acquiring banks will have to connect to by the end of 2022. Currently over 90 to 95% of issuing program banks are currently connected, and by the end of 2022 it will be mandatory for all VISA merchants, processors and acquirers.  This also includes the RDR and CDRN chargeback elimination systems as well.

This system monitors inquiries that occur POST transaction. When a customer issues an inquiry regarding a specific transaction or transactions, and while still on the telephone with a customer support representative at their issuing bank, there is a 10 second window that Visa allows, during which the existence of the transaction is confirmed and a resolution can be declared in real time.  

The alert, confirmation, and resolution is routed directly through VISAnet via the FRAUDdefender system. The response for high chargeback merchants will typically always be that the merchant is initiating a credit (refund).

All of this occurs within a window of 10 seconds after a customer inquiry, disputes will be resolved in real time, rather than the typical pattern where chargebacks show up at the acquirer 3 weeks after the customer makes a dispute.  This drastically reduces chargebacks, directly through this Visa initiated system.
column104:
Acella Financial, LLC is dedicated to offering banks and financial institutions worldwide the technology, knowledge, and experience needed in order to fully access the full range of opportunities available in the processing of payments in the onlineenvironment.  We utilize a large network built up over years of experience to bring all of the pieces necessary for an acquiring institution to process online payments, both maximizing returns while minimizing risk.

Our service covers all aspects related to transaction processing, from payment gateway technologies to merchant acquiring, fraud scrubbing, risk management and compliance procedures, as well as subsequent marketing of the banks platform to the correct merchant demographics.

Our PCI-compliant payment gateway and sophisticated risk management tools make the basis for secure online payment transactions, alternative payment solutions, direct debit and international merchant accounts.

column169:

We represent US, EU and Asian based merchant account solutions, ACH processers, gateway, site management, and "Alternative" billing solutions.     www.astralgrouponline.com

We are also partnered with T3report.com.   T3 report is marketing intelligence that allows you to find out where other site get their traffic.  Reports on competitive URLs will show you who their affiliates are, which ones are tending to send the most traffic, and will even show where those affiliates are getting THEIR traffic.

You can see what other sites those affiliates are sending  out traffic to, so that you can analyze their traffic. You can look at the exact webpages where the links are located, etc...   Since we do not rely on alexa data, you can drill through the large affiliate networks and see all of the linking domain relationships.

column626:
M&A from the plane…don’t you expect the plane to be full of fuel?

During a recent flight, I had a conversation with someone who was selling their company and was incredulous that he had to leave behind working capital as part of the transaction. 

I asked him why that was so upsetting? His response was, “I should be getting paid for my business and I should get to keep all my working capital.”

My response, “When you rent a car, don’t you expect the car to be full of gas when you drive out of the rental car location? Do you think the airline we are flying today should sell us a ticket, then, when we board, collect more money for jet fuel?” Of course, his response was “No, that’s included in the price of the rental car or the price of my plane ticket.”

Well, it is the same when buying your business. The buyer expects there to be fuel in the tank on the day they take over. The buyer does not pay you a multiple of EBITDA, then add more money to the deal to operate the business on day 1. 

The buyer, by paying a multiple of EBITDA, is also buying your balance sheet, and therefore is acquiring your working capital. 
When a buyer is considering purchasing your company, they expect the company to have a certain level of working capital in order to continue operating smoothly and meet its financial obligations. 

The buyer will want to see that the company has enough cash, accounts receivable, inventory, and other current assets to cover its current liabilities. Some of the key components of working capital include:
Cash and cash equivalents
Accounts receivable
Inventory
Accounts payable

To determine your company's working capital requirements, you will need to consider how much of these assets and liabilities you will need to maintain to continue operating your business. For example, if you operate a business that requires you to hold large amounts of inventory, your working capital requirements will be higher than a business that does not require a significant amount of inventory. 
 
 The quick math to determine your approximate working capital as you go into a deal is: Current Assets – Cash -Current Liabilities. This quick calculation will give you a snapshot of how much you will potentially be required to leave behind as part of the transaction.

This is an area where many M&A transactions run into trouble simply because the Seller does not understand how deals are structured and they have the erroneous thought that even after getting a multiple of EBITDA for their Company, they still expect to also walk away with their entire balance sheet.
column641:
𝗠&𝗔 𝗳𝗿𝗼𝗺 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗽𝗹𝗮𝗻𝗲 – What language is the pilot speaking?
 
𝗘𝗕𝗜𝗧𝗗𝗔
What is it?

I rarely have a conversation while on a plane and discussing mergers and acquisitions without the question of EBITDA arising. 

Many CEO’s have heard the term, but few really understand why buyers use 𝗘𝗕𝗜𝗧𝗗𝗔 𝘃𝘀. 𝗡𝗲𝘁 𝗜𝗻𝗰𝗼𝗺𝗲.

Since there is still some confusion around the topic, I decided to break it down by category to help arm you with key elements you need to know about EBITDA.

For starters, let’s focus on answering the following topics:

1. What is EBITDA?
2. How do you calculate EBITDA?
3. What is the rationale behind EBITDA?
4. What are the drawbacks of EBITDA?

 
Let’s dig into each one of these further in the carousel.

Full disclosure: All my answers are taken from personal experience and have been supplemented by sources such as BDC and Investopedia.

I am writing this letter to provide my wholehearted recommendation for Mr. Jim Varoutas. I had the pleasure of working with Jim for several years, when I held the position of Vice President of Implementation and Support at Wescom Resources Group.

In his role as an Implementations Engineer, Jim was responsible for the implementation of our Online Banking Application - a complex task that demanded proficiency in multiple technical fields. His tasks encompassed networking, server administration, and a thorough understanding of the Symitar Core. Moreover, he demonstrated an excellent ability to troubleshoot complicated issues, and his consistent focus on detail and deadlines ensured our projects were completed smoothly and on time.

One of Jim's most valuable skills was his knack for project management. He managed to juggle his technical responsibilities and project management with an effortless grace that truly set him apart. Not only was he able to ensure that projects were completed according to schedule, but he also expertly managed stakeholder expectations, proactively addressed issues and communicated effectively with all members of our team. This impressive balance demonstrated his versatility and commitment to excellence.

During his time with us, Jim's diligence, technical acumen, and unwavering commitment to quality were apparent to everyone who worked with him. His ability to integrate various skills and navigate complex projects was a driving force behind many of our successes. His willingness to go the extra mile, coupled with his consistent professional development, made him an indispensable member of our team.

I am confident that Jim will continue to be very successful and will make a significant contribution to any team. If you're looking for someone who is dedicated, technically skilled, and with great project management capabilities, I recommend Jim Varoutas without any reservations.
If you need any additional information, please feel free to contact me at the email or phone number listed above.


Sincerely,

Ed Gonzalez
Owner / COO
Best Innovation Group

column424: Tested 12 Spanish-English bilingual college students for the speed with which they could recognize a word in one language as a member of a previously presented set of words in either language. Reaction time increased with the size of the presented set of words. For most Ss, the increase in reaction time with set size was greater when the probe word differed in language from the presented word than when it was the same in language, a "translation effect" that has been found previously for newly learned translation schemes. Some, but not all, of these Ss were able to use prior information about the language of a probe word to speed their memory search. It is concluded that Ss store language-specific representations of presented words in the short-term recognition memory task used and that the translation effect reflects rehearsal processes taking place before a probe word is presented.
column426: The American Journal of Psychology, · Jun 1, 1978
column427: Translation between languages in memory search
column429: Based on a dual-process theory of memory, it was hypothesized that primary effects often observed in impression-formation studies are due to a reliance on information in long-term, as opposed to short-term, memory storage. Variables which have previously been shown to affect either long- or short-term memory were manipulated in 2 impression-formation experiments with a total of 244 undergraduates. It was found that a delay following stimulus presentation (which reduces short-term memory) had no effect on impressions, while inclusion of an irrelevant task during stimulus presentation (which reduces long-term memory) significantly reduced the degree of impression primacy.
column432: Use of long-term memory in impression formation

As a CEO; I grew a company’s revenue from 6 million to over 25 million annually and increased their portfolio Value from 100 million to 400 million. Once they exited that company I started my real estate firm. I grew it to a 100 million evaluation and achieved a 78 million dollar exit from a portion of the business within one year. I then founded Cashcow Capital to Create Real estate oppurtuinities for investors driven to generate wealth.

Cash Cow Capital is a dynamic real estate investment firm specializing in acquiring and managing mobile home communities and RV resorts. These communities have been on the rise in popularity and demand for years, making them lucrative investment opportunities.

By investing with us, you will have the opportunity to tap into a high-quality, large community resort market with exclusive amenities and hospitable neighbors. The RV industry has consistently broken records, year after year, making this an excellent time to invest in mobile home communities and RV resorts.

Our team sources beautiful, modern, and attractive manufactured housing communities to invest in. We seek to acquire investments generating significant buzz and offering substantial returns.

At Cash Cow Capital, we are passionate about creating sustainable and profitable investments that provide long-term benefits for our investors, our partners, and the communities we serve. By investing with us, you'll see a significant expansion in your passive income revenue stream.

column139:
Ligo Partners is a single family office based between Miami and New York. We co-invest with our discrete and invitation-only consortium of like-minded investors into disruptive tech-focused deal flow sourced directly from top venture capital firms and investors worldwide.

Hence, 100% of our deal flow has a lead, is warmly referred, often proprietary and mostly off-market.

Since 2022, Ligo Partners has deployed $415mm into 80 tech companies backed by tier-one investors – and successfully exited 9 companies. 

As of January 2024, Ligo Partners’ global platform co-invests with 3,500+ domestic and international family offices and qualified investors with a combined net worth of $300 billion who are interested in non-traditional, market-uncorrelated technology investment opportunities that have shown resilience to changes in the recent economic environment.

In parallel, Ligo Partners invests in tech debt financings; tech secondaries; roll-up strategies with a tech component and off-market real estate opportunities.

column453:
I've known Dave for a number of years, and he has become a good friend.
 
Dave has a very entrepreneurial spirit, and is one of the most connected people I know in the banking industry.  Through one of his contacts, he has opened the door for me to begin the discussions on a very large deal with the the Management of a bank holding company.  Through another one of his contacts, he has opened the door to another company that is interested in selling our software to large banks.
 
There are many character qualities I like about Dave.  First of all, I don't think you will find a more honest salesman.  I've seen him turn down a very lucrative deal because he didn't think the company he was representing could deliver the features the prospect wanted.  Secondly, he has the persistence to seek out new prospects, and the drive to follow up -- both qualities of a good salesman.  Thirdly, well, he's just a likeable guy!

column237: The Forbes ranking of Best-In-State Wealth Advisors, developed by SHOOK Research, is based on an algorithm of qualitative criteria and quantitative data. Those advisors who are considered have a minimum of seven years of experience, and the algorithm weighs factors like revenue trends, AUM, compliance records, industry experience and those who encompass best practices in their practices and approach to working with clients. Portfolio performance is not a criteria due to varying client objectives and lack of audited data. Out of 29,334 advisors nominated by their firms, 3,477 received the award. This ranking is not indicative of an advisor’s future performance, is not an endorsement, and may not be representative of an individual client’s experience. Neither Raymond James nor any of its financial advisors or RIA firms pay a fee in exchange for this award/rating. Raymond James is not affiliated with Forbes or Shook Research, LLC.

column1:
I am currently serving as Chief Operating Officer and Chief Financial Officer at ArkMalibu. ArkMalibu is an investment bank dedicated to helping owners sell their businesses.

We understand that selling a business is one of the most significant milestones in an owner’s journey. That’s why we are committed to preserving your legacy, securing prosperity, and honoring the years of hard work behind your company's success.

Our highly-tailored search process focuses on maximizing value by finding the best deal terms and cultural fit when it’s time for an ownership change. Supported by a vast network of industry experts from Wall Street, Fortune 500 companies, and Big 4 firms, we go beyond traditional deal-making to bring deep expertise to every transaction, customizing our approach to align with your vision and goals.

Our unique model provides the flexibility to create a personalized strategy designed around your objectives. Together, we’ll build an ambitious vision for the ideal partnership and execute a proven, creative buyer search that delivers outstanding results.

Proactive, results-oriented, trusted business leader with proven track record of results in operations, finance, marketing, and development roles. Possesses strong executive presence, interpersonal skills, analytical skills, ability to lead through change and strategic planning capabilities.

SRS Senior Advisors, each with over 35 years experience as regulators, banking industry executives and consultants, bring a unique perspective to client assignments. column1:
With 30+ years of experience, I’ve transformed banks, fintech ventures, and PE-backed platforms from $300M community institutions to multi-billion-dollar enterprises and global financial institutions.

My career began at GE, where I rose to senior leadership and led a $2B commercial lending business by age 28. Earned certification as a GE Six Sigma Master Black Belt, recognized for driving enterprise-wide, data-informed transformation with a focus on operational efficiency. Since then, I’ve led growth, regulatory remediation, and enterprise modernization across Fortune 500s, fintech pioneers, and institutions regulated by the FRB, OCC, and FDIC.

A hands-on, execution first leader, I bring a pragmatic approach to innovation grounded in operational excellence, regulatory credibility, and strategic impact.

I’m passionate about the mission of community banking—where customer centricity, disciplined execution, and emerging technology intersect.

I designed a real-time digital command center, now powering AI-driven crypto settlement and blockchain-based transaction routing. This eliminates legacy friction and enables secure, scalable infrastructure.

I’ve launched trust banks and asset management platforms, embedded finance solutions, and revitalized distressed institutions to drive long-term value creation.

✅ C-Suite Leadership | CEO | COO | CIO
• Led capital raises, market expansion, and digital transformation
• Held full P&L at FIS as Global Product Officer for Bank Core, Wealth & Asset Mgmt, and Global Payments

✅ Fintech, SaaS & Blockchain Innovation
• Built a SaaS payments platform generating $358M+ in 3 years
• Delivered the first in-vehicle AI payments platform for Ford-Werke GmbH (Ford Germany)
• Scaled open banking APIs, embedded finance, and tokenized rails
• Acquired and integrated T. Rowe Price Retirement Advisory (800+ employees)

✅ Global Scale & Regulatory Expertise
• Led teams across the U.S., EMEA, and APAC in credit, cards, crypto, and ops
• Designed architecture aligned with FDIC, OCC & NYDFS mandates—including BitLicense, crypto marketing, and consumer protection
• Resolved MRAs, MOUs, and Consent Orders; improved CAMELS ratings
• Served on FRB Payments Advisory Boards; advised on CEO succession and governance

🗣 CEO and fintech strategist trusted voice on AI, blockchain, and culture-led transformation. Experienced in building businesses and turning around complex financial platforms.

📩 Open to board roles, advisory work, and executive opportunities aligned with mission and impact. 

Media/speaking inquiries: zazzerajohn@gmail.com
