column1:
I have provided financing to renewable energy project developers, CRE investors/developers, middle market companies, ESOPs, REITs, and family offices for over two decades.

Consider me a resource for all your needs related to commercial real estate (CRE) lending, commercial (C&I) lending, renewable energy project finance, ESOP finance, and treasury management.

Delivering lending solutions and consultation services for CRE projects with a focus on environmental sustainability. Our team is leading the way in impact banking as a Certified B Corp bank in the southeast US. 

My team can assist with financing needs including CRE lending, equipment finance, solar project finance, lines of credit, and other C&I lending solutions. Beyond conventional lending, through our SBA group we can provide business owners with financing for acquisition, expansion, and more. Out structured finance division can assist with ABL, factoring, and more. 

Climate First Bank's CRE Correspondent Lending Group can assist with Agency and CMBS lending solutions for your projects nationwide with loan amounts ranging from $1mm to $250mm or more. 

Climate First Bank provides competitive financing for companies converting to ESOP. We offer flexibility in structure and covenants to support a smooth transition. 

As a Senior Advisor at OneEthos, I can help community banks, credit unions, and CDFIs to incorporate green lending as a component of their loan portfolio. OneEthos can also partner with green banks to help the execute their missions more efficiently and scalably by leveraging our technology and ethical lending programs.

Specialties: Leadership, Strategic Planning & Execution, Commercial Lending, Commercial Real Estate, Electric Vehicle (EV) Charging Station Infrastructure Finance, Commercial/C&I Solar Finance, Community Solar Finance, Residential Solar Lending, CRE Analysis, Commercial Banking, Business Development, Finance, SBA Lending, Community Relations, Negotiation, Commercial Underwriting, Financial Analysis, Business Consulting, ESOP Finance
column69: As CSO, I shape the strategic direction of the Company, oversee mission-aligned specialty finance initiatives, and drive growth through innovative revenue opportunities at Climate First Bank and fintech affiliate OneEthos.
column79:
Oversee strategic initiatives for company, develop commercial banking opportunities focused on impact including solar project finance, ESOP finance, and more. Oversee special projects related to product development & strategies to support the values-based banking model.

When you choose to bank with Climate First, you can go to sleep at night knowing that your money will be redeployed into financing that supports positive social and environmental impact in the community.

At Climate First Bank our vision is to reimagine finance as a force for good and become the most impactful bank contributing to the drawdown of atmospheric CO2. Climate First Bank is a nationwide digital community bank offering personal and commercial banking services with a focus on environmental sustainability. 

At Climate First Bank we do our part to preserve America’s irreplaceable ecosystem by providing residents and businesses with convenient, specialized green loan options for everything ranging from rooftop solar to renewable energy to building retrofits, EV charging, and more.

column1:
Ken Wanek is founder, president and CEO of Datatrac, a market research company and advertising agency specializing in the banking industry.

Ken and his team at Datatrac built America's largest database of deposit and lending rates from over 100,000 banking locations in North America and have served over 5,000 bank and credit union clients.

Ken is a regular speaker at tradeshows and events, presenting at conferences held by the American Bankers Association, Credit Union National Association and other industry leaders.  His research has been used by the Government Accountability Office, the Federal Reserve and included in reports to the Ways And Means Committee and House of Representatives.

Ken's work has been quoted in USA Today, Wall Street Journal, CBS MarketWatch, SmartMoney, Consumers Digest, Kiplinger’s Personal Finance, Washington Post, Chicago Tribune and the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel among many others. Ken was also a columnist for the Los Angeles Times contributing articles on personal finance.

Datatrac was founded by Ken at the age of twenty-one.  Prior to launching Datatrac, Ken was the Director of Financial Planning for a Milwaukee accounting firm.  He has held various professional licenses in securities and insurance including a Registered Representative, Registered Investment Advisor and Certified Financial Planner.

Ken is past chairman of the annual Wisconsin Entrepreneur Conference.  He has served several terms under appointment of Governor Doyle on the Wisconsin Development Fund Board, an organization providing over $10 million annually in funding to Wisconsin businesses.

Ken attended University of Wisconsin-Stevens Point at the age of sixteen and completed his degree in financial planning from the College of Financial Planning in Denver, Colorado. Ken is currently a sailing instructor at the University of Wisconsin Madison-Hoofers Sailing Club.  His hobbies include motorcycling, sailing, scuba diving, fitness and playing guitar and ukulele.

column424:
More than 50% of consumers choose someone other than their primary financial institution for new deposit and loan products.  This whitepaper defines ground-breaking solutions to grow your retail banking portfolio in a digital age and shows you how to change the rateshopping paradigm to stop rateshoppers in their tracks . . . even if you do not have the best rates.  

Key takeaways include: 
•	Three Point Proof Test to ensure you are the obvious choice.  
•	Proven formula for increasing marketshare and walletshare.
•	How the Benchmarking Effect and the Halo Effect increase your perceived value.
•	Six segmentation strategies that prove you outperform in your competitive niche. 
•	How to grow your portfolio without losing margin or getting into a rate war. 
•	Free Competitive Analysis for financial institutions.

Whitepaper also includes five case studies that generate over $200 million in new deposits and loans with an ‘all in’ cost of less than $70 per new account and ROIS up to 644%.
column427: Whitepaper:  Driving Deposit & Loan Growth in a Digital Economy

Thornton Group, with offices in both Boston and Beijing, is a cross-border capital intermediary whose purpose is to facilitate the strategic vision of its clients by providing advisory services and deal structuring expertise. 

Thornton is a bridge between the East and the West by combining its Western business experience with its unique Chinese local market insight and network.
 
Using this model Thornton has been able to build a robust business portfolio that has included representing clients in the infrastructure, financial services, technology, TMT, agriculture, energy resources and the mining sectors in a variety of different international transactions.

Thornton has worked with clients in a variety of ways including providing strategic consulting services, corporate structuring, sourcing business opportunities in the Chinese market for firms in diverse business sectors, and negotiating major international commercial transactions.

Solebury Thornton is a china based WOFE owned and operated by Thornton and its partner Solebury Capital Group, a US broker dealer.  Together we provide Equity Capital Markets Advisory and Investor Relations services for Greater China based companies pre and post IPO on the US exchanges.  Solebury Thornton also provides M&A advisory services for clients engaged in cross border transactions.

At Precision Payments Incorporated we provide customized solutions and personalized customer service for every facet of payment processing.  We realize that every business is different and requires a unique payment processing plan.  Therefore, we believe that getting to know our clients and their respective businesses is the best way to identify the best solution for them.  Furthermore, after initially earning your business we will continue to listen and address any concerns you may have.  We keep our clients updated on changes which occur in the industry and informed of new products or services as they become available which could potentially improve upon or compliment their existing solution.

With us, you will be afforded the peace of mind brought by knowing that we will be there when you need us.  We realize and are appreciative of the faith and trust instilled upon us by our clients and proactively seek out ways to show it.       

We don’t just want to earn your business; we want to become an asset to your business!

column1:
Get a FREE guide to learn how to instantly form a fund or syndication by going to Raises.com/linkedin

Real estate syndicators and business buyers who haven't raised above $1m are working way too hard raising small amounts of capital and netting tiny profit margins from their acquisitions or funds. 

Picture this: closing a $10m+ multifamily acquisition or fund, and having a team under you that helps you compliantly raise funds from accredited investors, netting profit margins on a larger deal for you to do the next one.

That’s what most talk about, yet cease to ever accomplish...

After servicing multiple offerings and raising $150m+, 

 I've noticed a pattern of why most minor dealmakers haven’t "graduated" to $10m+ multifamily acquisitions or business buyouts. I've distilled it down to 3 key broken systems:

System #1. Setup — You Don't know how to set up the legal/financials/securities to raise $10m+. 

Without this setup system, there is a risk of non-compliance fines and litigation.

System #2. Mandate — No systems in place to know the investor mandates

Without knowing what investors want before you setup your offering you're gambling by paying lawyers to build expensive PPMs for unfundable deals. You risk paying six figures  to a securities attorney to build your fund or offering just for your deal not to raise a single cent.

System #3. Outreach — Limited by having no processes to get it happening all for you

Don't have the network, relationships and systems to actually close large equity investors (they don't know one person in real life qualified to invest)

Now, if you're facing any of these broken systems, I have good news! These are completely avoidable and reversible if you just follow the right process. 

At Raises.com, we are client-obsessed helping entrepreneurs succeed by building these systems.

At Raises.com, you can swiftly prepare your new real estate fund, rolls-ups, or acquisitions in as little as 2-weeks, then begin to raise $10 million+ for all while joining a new movement of founders saving months of time and millions of dollars in the process. (Ex-executives from J.P. Morgan, Merrill Lynch, KPMG, Standard Bank, US Federal Election Commission, Slate Street. Including founders at Roofing.com, 99Homes, and the US Housing Exchange have raised millions)

Get a FREE guide to learn how to instantly form a fund or syndication by going to Raises.com/linkedin

What Raises.com does (click see more)

Raises.com is a group of fintech platforms and registered brokers run by experts in helping people setup and raise capital for new funds and acquisitions. Our focus is working with real estate syndicators & business buyers.

How Raises.com does it

Raises.com group of companies are fintech companies and financial institutions that work with our private members to help them prepare their funds or acquisitions, as well as relationships to raise $10m+ & close the deal. Our consultants and chartered financial analysts add members to our private communities to assist on a 1-on-1 basis in finishing all financial, compliance and legal paperwork so that you have a compliant offering in as little as 2 weeks (saving about $80,000). Then, building a scalable sales team under you to reach out to investors, and leverage Raises.com's proprietary automations and brand into your capital raise for added traction to close your $10m+ fund or acquisition. 

What makes Raises.com different

After raising $260m+, we focus on simplicity through world-class communities, systems and information

Don't take my word for it — check out our case studies below from our successful members.

column1:
Mergers & Acquisitions and Capital Raising Expert Across the Americas | Investment Banker | Corporate Advisor

With over 30 years of experience in Mergers & Acquisitions (M&A) and Capital Raising, I help companies navigate complex financial transactions to drive growth, expansion, and long-term value creation. I have advised on 100+ mandates, contributing to transactions exceeding $3 billion across multiple industries.

As Managing Director at Latam Investment Banking, I lead a team focused on tailored financial advisory solutions, ensuring clients secure optimal outcomes in M&A and capital raising efforts. 

My expertise spans strategic deal structuring, international investor networking, and cross-border transactions, providing clients with the insights and execution they need to thrive in dynamic markets.

Previous Experience: 
- Director at Pan American Finance (Miami)
- Senior Consultant at Santo Domingo Group (New York & Miami)
- Vice President at Violy, Byorum & Partners (New York)

Education & Thought Leadership: 
Engineering & MBA from Universidad de los Andes (Colombia), with postgraduate studies at Harvard Business School (Boston), Kellogg School of Management (Chicago), and London School of Economics (United Kingdom).

Finance Professor at the University of Miami Herbert Business School, and a speaker and panelist on corporate finance trends, investment strategies, and M&A best practices.

Passionate about deal-making, financial strategy, and helping businesses unlock new opportunities.

Fluent in English, Spanish and Italian, and basic Portuguese.

Open to discussions on M&A transactions, investment opportunities, and corporate finance strategies.

column641:
Fourteen years ago (when my youngest son was born), I decided to embark on a new challenge - building a boutique investment bank specialized in M&A and capital raising for the Americas. My vision was, and continues to be, not just about structuring deals; it was about earning the trust of clients, navigating complex negotiations, and adapting to market shifts. 

Based on these principles, Latam Investment Banking was founded to bring tailored financial solutions to businesses in the Americas. My goal was to leverage my investment banking track record working in New York and Latin America to pursue this new opportunity.

I appreciate my clients who believed in this vision, the high-impact transactions that helped companies scale, and, of course, the difficult moments that tested our resilience.

This journey has been one of growth, learning, and transformation, and none of it would have been possible without the trust of our clients, the dedication of our team, and the strong relationships built along the way.

As we celebrate this milestone, I look forward to continuing to support businesses in the Americas in navigating strategic decisions, unlocking new opportunities, and shaping the investment landscape in the region.

Thank you to everyone who has been part of this incredible journey!

column1:
I’m the founder of Davison Holdings, where we don’t just acquire properties—we transform them.

Over the past two decades, I’ve focused on distressed assets in the manufactured housing and single-family rental (SFR) space. Through Davison Holdings, I source, develop, and reposition communities and portfolios across Florida, Arizona, Nevada, and California. Whether it’s a 50-space manufactured home park or a 300-home SFR package, I approach every project with hands-on oversight and a clear goal: improve the asset, build community value, and deliver strong returns.

My expertise lies in evaluating underperforming properties, managing full-scope rehabs, navigating tricky compliance issues (including FLDEP and zoning), and bringing teams together to get projects done—on time and under budget. I’ve worked with cities, state agencies, contractors, designers, and investors to take properties from neglected to thriving.

Through Davison Holdings and partnerships with firms like EquiAlt and Escal8Build, I’ve built a track record of uncovering upside where others might not look—and executing with integrity.
column16: B.S. Political Science, Cal State San Marcos
column69:
As General Manager of Davison Holdings, I lead the day-to-day execution of a third-generation real estate legacy—one rooted in integrity, innovation, and long-term value creation. Building on the Lano family’s history that began in 1945 with Bellfair Park, I focus on modernizing operations, expanding our footprint, and delivering high-performing assets that serve both investors and communities.

My role spans sourcing and repositioning properties, overseeing construction and compliance, and guiding the evolution of our vertically integrated portfolio. With a deep respect for the legacy that came before me, I bring a hands-on, forward-thinking approach to managing assets that are built to last.
column104:
At iCashflow, I lead the development and execution of real estate investment strategies that prioritize flexibility, transparency, and long-term value. Our approach is centered on creative deal structuring—whether assisting families in transitioning out of legacy assets or repositioning properties to meet modern lending and market standards.

As both a project manager and operator, I oversee everything from property evaluations and acquisition modeling to renovation planning and stakeholder communications. My role bridges the gap between strategic vision and operational execution, ensuring that each project aligns with our mission to create sustainable, community-focused real estate solutions.

Key Projects - 

Tenoroc Park LLC: Oversaw the $3.2M redevelopment of a distressed manufactured home community, taking it from regulatory non-compliance to full rehab and 3X occupancy growth. Managed environmental permitting, infrastructure upgrades, and full tenant acquisition. Worked directly with FLDEP and local contractors to bring the property into modern compliance.

column453:
We met Ted about 18 months ago when my wife and I were casually thinking about relocating to Florida. Though he knew we were on a fact finding mission with no clear plan, Ted gave us the time as if we were on the hunt for a house. Over the coming year he remained in touch and continued to answer our questions. So when we decided that Florida was our relocation destination our first call was to Ted. 

Ted was a pleasure to have as our guide and advisor. Even when his family vacation conflicted with when we were coming to Florida to see houses, he had a colleague ready to take his place. Myself being in a service business, I very much appreciated his diligence and patience. He stayed with us through our closing and now weeks later continues to check in on us.

I highly recommend Ted. In addition to being professional, knowledgable and wise he is a great guy!

column1:
Shelly Berensen is an industry-leading payment processing solutions executive in the industry for over 25 years and the CEO of Specialized Processing Systems.  During her exciting career in this industry dominated by mega-banks, Shelly has lead a team of astute business process development professionals, highly skilled computer programmers and system engineers, allowing her to develop one of the most highly advanced payment processing platforms in the industry.

“The Platform”

Leveraging the latest technologies available in the 21st century, Specialized Processing Solutions has developed “The Platform” – leaps and bounds ahead of the technology of the 1970s payment processing platforms in use by the majority of merchants across the globe.  These outdated platforms are inefficient and not flexible, prohibiting most merchants from receiving the best possible processing rate on each individual transaction.  

Bringing UnionPay to the Masses

Shelly Berensen and Specialized Processing Solutions have worked for over three years in partnership with China Union Pay (CUP) to develop a 100% reliable processing solutions.  In the world, CUP branded cards outnumber Visa branded cards.  Most merchants in the US don’t even accept UnionPay, blocking the 3.5 billion cardholders from conducting transactions with US merchants.  Now, in a marketing partnership, Shelly Berensen is leading the way for an increased level of acceptance of UnionPay in the United States with CUP provided SMS, web and in-statement marketing of newly acquired merchants.

column1:
Storm is ranked one of the top 5 Tech M&A bankers of all time (VentureBeat 2024), one of the Top 50 M&A Dealmakers in the World (Atlas M&A Award 2024), and is a winner of the 2024 ”M&A Leadership Award” as well as multiple M&A and Growth Financing Deal of the Year awards.  He has executed 2 of the top 10 ranked M&A deals of all time (Business Insider), and is the founder of Ignatious (VentureBeat top 5 Tech M&A Boutique, and Atlas 2024 Technology Boutique Investment Bank of the Year), an investment bank focused on the AI future (horizontal / generative AI, vertical / applied AI and agentic AI, as well as previously established technology companies across all sectors transitioning to an AI future).

Storm has advised many of the most iconic companies and defining transactions in the technology sector, and served as primary strategic advisor to Google for a decade, including the highest returning acquisition in history (YouTube) and DoubleClick amongst many others. He sold MySQL to Sun, and then sold Sun to Oracle; sold Apple its first full stack autonomous vehicle company; sold Tinder to Match; merged Careem with Uber (Global Deal of the Year); secured AMD’s future leadership in CPUs with the sale of Nexgen; sold Netfish for $270mm two days before filing for bankruptcy; led the only equity recovery ever for a software company in bankruptcy (Peregrine), and sold AOL the first DARPANet node, amongst many other groundbreaking transactions.

His top five ranked tech advisory firm, Ignatious, focuses exclusively on capturing extraordinary financial outcomes for emerging growth technology companies, their visionary leaders, and the investors that support them by aligning these great companies with the best strategic and financial partners through Ignatious' unmatched M&A and private capital raising expertise.

Prior to Ignatious, Storm lead two of the top Technology investment banks and served as CEO/Co-founder of three startups in the technology space, including an award winning venture-backed start-up spun out of MIT.  He has managed businesses ranging in size from startups to $1bb of annual revenue, founded 3 new corporate divisions with over $500 mm of annual revenue, and grew a declining mature division over 400% in less than 5 years.

Storm is a frequent speaker and panelist at technology, M&A and mobility/transportation conferences, was the #1 ranked Jefferies Podcaster, a guest lecturer at Harvard Law School and Stanford University, and co-authored and co-taught a course on mergers and acquisitions at Stanford Law School.

Astra is an international firm highly specialized in delivering wealth planning solutions for high-net-worth and ultra-high-net-worth families across Latin America.

With deep expertise in the protection, optimization, and intergenerational transfer of wealth, Astra empowers private clients to achieve their long-term objectives through customized and strategic planning.

Astra collaborates closely and continuously with financial and legal advisors across the United States, Europe, and Latin America to design and implement comprehensive, adaptive plans tailored to the unique needs of each family.

Astra is led by Rafael Alvarez, TEP, a member of the Society of Trust and Estate Practitioners (STEP Miami), underscoring the firm’s commitment to international best practices and professional excellence in cross-border wealth planning.

Our mission at Astra is to be the trusted partner of choice for financial and legal advisors serving Latin American private clients.

The graduate of the Law degree is a professional with solid knowledge in Legal Science, both in the national and international legal frameworks, as well as in the relationship between Law and the Social and Humanistic Sciences in general. This enables them to develop analytical skills to solve legal problems with a humanistic approach.

During their education, they acquire abilities and skills not only for legal representation and practicing law in situations of established conflict, but also for the development of preventive lawyering, acting as an advisor, negotiator, or mediator.

They are professionals with a clear awareness of their social and ethical responsibility as guarantors of freedoms and the Rule of Law.

I’m an entrepreneur passionate about creating solutions that empower people and businesses to thrive.

As Founder of Twin Valley Capital, I help business owners access fast, flexible capital when traditional financing isn’t an option. Our private money lending platform specializes in asset-based loans, unlocking liquidity for growth and opportunity with straightforward underwriting and speed.

I also serve as President of BeeCovered, an Administrator of Vehicle Service Contracts and Home Warranties. At BeeCovered, we take the sting out of high repair bills by offering reliable protection and peace of mind to our customers nationwide.

Throughout my career, I’ve focused on building companies that solve real problems with transparency, integrity, and creativity. Whether it’s funding a business expansion or protecting families from unexpected repair costs, I believe in making financial solutions simple, accessible, and effective.

Let’s connect if you’re looking to partner, collaborate, or learn more about how I can support your goals.

column69:
Twin Valley Capital (TVC) operates within two capacities; alternative lending and management consulting. 

The lending arm of TVC provides business purpose loans to individuals and entities that can't procure commercial funding through conventional sources.

The consulting arm of TVC provides small to medium size businesses with retainer-based management consulting and business coaching services.  These services include, strategic planning, goal setting, performance reviews, accountability partnerships, financial reviews, corporate restructuring, debt restructuring, turn-around, and negotiation services.
column104:

When you’re faced with high costs from unforeseen circumstances, we’re here to protect you with affordable and customized coverage for both your home and automobile.

We aim to provide an unmatched level of customer service while always striving to be an ally to our partners in business.

We’re on a mission to provide exceptional Home and Auto service plans to our customers, operate with the utmost transparency with our business partners, and implement ancillary services to empower our partners toward excellence. column149:
I was one of three founding members of the Jefferies Industrials Group. My challenge was to establish the firm’s presence in the basic materials sectors: steel, metals, paper, packaging, building products, building materials, and mining. 

Initially I covered all of these sectors, then over time I hired and managed senior sector specialists to focus on each sub-vertical while narrowing my personal focused to steel, metals, and mining.

I built the leading middle-market Steel & Metals group on Wall Street, growing the business to the #1 bank by market share in all target products, including M&A, IPOs, equity, and high yield. By building trusted relationships with CEOs, CFOs, and board members at major corporations, I was able to secure underwriting and advisory roles in capital markets and strategic transactions for Jefferies, then follow through with flawless execution.  I completed transactions ranging from $100 million to more than $7 billion.

Representative clients by transaction type include the following: 

IPO: Ryerson, Globe Specialty Metals (now Ferroglobe), MetalsUSA (now Reliance), Luxfer, Edgen Group, and Claymont Steel. 

Equity: Materion, Oregon Steel (now Evraz NA), AM Castle, Fortescue Metals, DMC, and Novamerican Steel. 

Bonds: Essar Steel (now Algoma), Edgen Group, Ryerson, Zekelman Industries, AM Castle, Optima Steel, and Tempel Steel (now Worthington). 

Term Loans: Essar Steel (now Algoma), Zekelman Industries, AM Castle, Packaging Dynamics, Ft. Dearborn, and Lincoln Paper.  

M&A:  Edgen Group, Optima Specialty Steel, AM Castle, Claymont Steel, RathGibson, and Olympic Steel. 

Restructuring: Alpha Natural Resources, Patriot Coal, RathGibson, Abitibi-Bowater, and Pliant.

column1:
The mission of the ICRG is to help individuals and families affected by gambling disorder and to prevent the onset of gambling problems through high quality scientific research and evidence-based educational programming on gambling disorder and responsible gambling.

As the gaming industry grows and evolves throughout the world, the powerful research of the International Center for Responsible Gaming is driving change and leading the field forward. Since 1996, we have provided independent, peer-reviewed research that helps increase the understanding of gambling harms and find effective methods of mitigation. Our work is impacting public policy, strengthening responsible gambling and improving the health and well-being of the people and communities affected by the continued growth of the industry.

Nearly $40 million has been committed to the ICRG, through contributions from the casino gaming industry, equipment manufacturers, vendors, sports wagering companies, tribal casinos, related organizations and individuals. The funding chart below provides a detailed description of how the ICRG firewall protects the integrity of the research we fund.

column1:
David is an entrepreneur and dealmaker.  He is founder and CEO of McCombie Group, an M&A advisory firm that helps mid-market business owners sell their life's work at the best possible price, fit, and terms.  The firm is proud of its guiding philosophy: 'How would we advise our own family's business?'  To date, he has successfully closed billions in transactions. Unique amongst advisors, he has successfully led various private equity investments.  

David is author of "Selling Your Business with Confidence" published by Wiley.  An ongoing contributor to Forbes regarding middle-market M&A and private equity, he also has been a featured speaker at various private equity conferences and has been profiled in the Wall Street Journal and Bloomberg. 

David is also an owner and board member of Atlantic Tractor, a John Deere dealership with 18 locations across Maryland, Delaware, and southern Pennsylvania.  He is an active member of Young Presidents Organization (YPO) and serves as Chair of its Investment Banking network and Membership Officer of the Miami chapter. 

Prior to founding McCombie Group in 2010, David was a management consultant at McKinsey & Company and an investment banker at Citigroup Global Banking in New York.

David graduated from Harvard Law School where he focused on corporate law and negotiation strategy, and also did extensive coursework in corporate finance at the Harvard Business School. His thesis, Hispanic Private Equity- A Cultural Approach to Achieving Superior Investment Returns was published in the Harvard Latino Law Review.  He graduated Phi Beta Kappa from the University of Miami with a degree in economics and finance, where he was a Cuban American National Foundation Mas Scholar. A proud Cane, he taught FIN499, a private equity course, as an adjunct professor at the University of Miami and now serves as a Finance department advisory board member and an executive committee member of the Citizens Board.  David is also a licensed Florida attorney and real estate broker.

column626:
Last week, I had the honor of launching my book—a project years in the making, born out of both my own experiences and the countless stories shared by business owners navigating one of the biggest decisions of their lives: selling their business.

Celebrating the launch with friends, family, and colleagues offered a powerful reminder of why I began this journey in the first place. Writing this book wasn’t just about explaining the technical steps of a sale; it was about creating a comprehensive guide that equips owners with the knowledge they need to confidently face what can be an incredibly complex process.

To every business owner out there, I understand the passion, hard work, and persistence you pour into your company. Selling a business is so much more than a transaction—it’s the culmination of years of dedication. My hope is that this book serves as a trusted resource, offering clarity and insight at every step.

Thank you to everyone who made this launch possible and to those who celebrated alongside me. It’s been quite the journey, and I’m excited to see where it leads next.

#SellingYourBusinesswithConfidence #bookauthor #mergersandacquisitions #entrepreneur

column1:
Chris is a Managing Director of Originations at VRA, a boutique investment bank committed to providing M&A, capital raising and strategic advisory services to business owners and executive teams interested in achieving new levels of growth or navigating key periods of transition. VRA's team of investment bankers think beyond tactical execution, applying bespoke strategies for outstanding outcomes. VRA finds success by prioritizing its clients and people. The team has collectively completed over 650 transactions, in every case by working in close partnership with business owners to get the right deal done. VRA dedicates senior-level resources with industry-specific expertise to each engagement, leveraging deep relationships formed through decades of delivering trusted advice. The team has extensive transaction experience, combined with deep sector expertise in the following industries: Business Services, Consumer, Healthcare, Industrial and Technology. For more information, please visit www.vrapartners.com.

Before joining VRA, Chris co-founded and served as a Principal at Heritage Growth Partners LLC, a private multi-family investment office, where he sourced new investment opportunities and capital. Chris also interned at New Silk Growth Capital, an Asia-focused growth equity fund headquartered India. Chris started his career as a financial auditor at Ernst & Young LLP, covering various sectors such as financial services, transportation, manufacturing, waste management, and healthcare. He also worked as a senior internal auditor at Cabot Corporation, a global specialty chemicals and performance materials company. Chris holds an MBA from the Goizueta Business School at Emory University, a Master's degree in Accounting from Florida State University, and a Bachelor of Science in Accounting from Florida State University.

With over 39 years of work experience in the financial and real estate sectors, I am a seasoned and passionate leader who believes in creating positive social and environmental impact through responsible and innovative banking and investment practices. As the Chief Business Officer at Areti Bank, I oversee the strategic direction and execution of the bank's business development, marketing, and customer relations functions, while ensuring alignment with the bank's mission and values of sustainability, humanism, and ethics. I bring diverse perspectives and experiences to the team, having worked in different markets, cultures, and industries, and having earned a B.S. in Manufacturing Engineering from Boston University.

In my current role, I leverage my skills and expertise in investments, financial services, and business relationship management to identify and pursue new opportunities, expand and retain existing clients, and enhance the bank's brand and reputation in the market. I work closely with the bank's leadership, partners, and stakeholders to develop and implement effective and innovative solutions that meet the needs and expectations of our clients, who are looking for sustainable and profitable ways to invest their money and support companies that adhere to the environmental, social, and governance (ESG) factors. I also lead and mentor a team of talented and motivated professionals who share my vision and passion for sustainable banking and investment.

column1:
20 years ago, Anthony Angelillo moved to Florida to start his illustrious career in the mortgage industry. An inspired entrepreneur, Anthony has been able to enact his dream of streamlining the industry through the use of automated technology to educate clients and get them to the closing table in a timely manner. He is the CEO/Founder of Tag Lending Group and TAGTEAMNATION in Miami, he offers personalized, informative service to clients across Florida.
Anthony understands the importance of ensuring his clients know how to find success within the mortgage sector. By implementing intake forms to gather information from clients (primarily through high-quality video content), Tag Team has the ability to use that information to offer the clients a “Road Map to Homeownership”. “Our proprietary workflow really makes the process easier to handle for a lot of people,” Anthony says. “The mortgage industry doesn’t always do a great job of making itself approachable, so I’ve taken it upon myself to do just that, and I think people really appreciate it.”
Anthony keeps things straight to the point and delivers information to his clients in a prompt and honest manner. “When you work with my branch, there’s no runaround or smoke and mirrors. What you see is what you get,” Anthony says. “The level of transparency we employ is incredibly important in making clients feel at ease and empowering them to make the best possible decisions for themselves and their families.” Offering clarity and direction on a grand scale is Anthony’s MO. He did $60M in total volume last year and with his technology expects to produce at a higher rate in the years to come.
Anthony was awarded Miami’s Top Loan Officer of the Year and featured in Scotsman Guide in 2018, 2019, 2020, and 2021 for being one of the top 1% of originators in the nation. He is the co-host of the award-winning podcast, Damage Control, with Melinda Grimaldi, wherein they have discussions on a number of topics with a variety of guests within the world of real estate, all of which help educate Realtors on the best practices to improve their business.
Anthony got into the mortgage industry primarily as a method to help people – he believes every family has a shot at achieving the American Dream and prides himself on providing a “tag team” approach by working cohesively with Realtors, buyers, listing agents, and title agents. If you’re looking for a Mortgage Officer in Florida/US who excels at coming up with effective solutions specific to his client’s needs, look no further than Anthony Angelillo!

column402:
Anthony J. Angelillo is a preferred HUD Licensed, Senior Mortgage Banker currently working with Florida contractors in all financial transactions part of The HUD Stabilization Program.

The Neighborhood Stabilization Program (NSP) was established for stabilizing communities that have suffered from foreclosures and the goal to purchase and redevelopment of foreclosed/abandoned homes.

NSP1, a term that references the NSP funds authorized under Division B, Title III of the Housing and Economic Recovery Act (HERA) of 2008, provides grants to all states and selected local governments on a formula basis.

NSP2, a term that references the NSP funds authorized under the American Recovery and Reinvestment Act (the Recovery Act) of 2009, provides grants to states, local governments, nonprofits and a consortium of nonprofit entities on a competitive basis. The Recovery Act also authorized HUD to establish NSP-TA, a $50 million allocation made available to national providers to support NSP grantees.

NSP3, a term that references the NSP funds authorized under the Dodd–Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (Dodd-Frank Act) of 2010, provides a third round of neighborhood stabilization grants to all states and select governments on a formula basis.

column453:
I have been in the real estate profession for over 10 years, with the majority of my time specializing as a Senior Mortgage Banker.  A major contribution to my success correlates with having excellent partners that go above and beyond their call of duty, and provide the level of service that clients demand in this competitive market.  
We all work with a special partner that helps alleviate some of the challenges we face in running a successful operation.  In my case, that would be making referrals to agents and trusting them to deliver on their promise.  I am sure most of us can relate, because in almost any businesses or profession, in order to be successful you have to have everyone working together to achieve a common goal.  No different than any sports team that needs to bond together and have that camaraderie in order to win a championship.

I'm proud to say I have that special partner /Realtor, Ann Rogers.   I am 100% confident that when I refer a client to Ann to handle their real estate transaction.  I know that client is going to be treated with the utmost respect and be provided with the level of service they deserve when making such an important decision in their life (purchasing a home). 
When you deal with a professional like Ann, her clients remain her clients for life.  They appreciate all the effort she puts into listening to them and working so persistently to find them their dream home!  I can tell you, not many people spend the time to listen, but that's what separates Ann. 

Ann is my "Go to Agent" when I need someone to take special care of my clients in the Tampa Bay Area.

I only see growth and success in her company.  

Professional, Experienced, and Straight Forward!

York & Associates is an executive recruitment firm dedicated to helping employers secure the best talent in the financial sector.
For over 35 years, York & Associates has created a successful enterprise working almost exclusively with Banks and Credit Unions. Our clients include large diversified financial services companies such as Wells Fargo to the Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland to small community banks such as The Commercial Bank of Honea Path. column1:
As President/CEO of Hello Credit Union, Mike is committed to fostering a culture of growth—for both his team and the communities they serve. With over 20 years in financial services, he began his career on the front lines, gaining firsthand experience that shaped his people-first leadership approach. Since becoming CEO in 2019, he has prioritized staff development, ensuring employees have the tools and training needed to thrive and make a meaningful impact.

Under Mike’s leadership, Hello Credit Union has expanded its role as a Community Development Financial Institution (CDFI), securing over $5 million in grants to support financial empowerment initiatives. These funds have fueled subprime auto loans and credit builder programs, directly improving economic mobility for underserved individuals. The credit union also champions financial education, providing free counseling and courses to its Select Employee Group, the Florida Department of Agriculture and Consumer Services, and the broader community. By investing in both his team and the people they serve, Mike continues to drive sustainable growth and positive change.

column1:
As an attorney I practice in both business law and healthcare law. My firm provides exceptional customer service through a unique and cost effective concierge-type program. From small businesses to large healthcare medical practices, each client’s goals and needs frame how we work together. 

At the age of nine, I started working in my family’s business, and experienced all the aspects of starting, building, and running a business. I’ve been a teacher, a teamster, a farmhand, a clerk, a businessman, and a lawyer. I also have the contacts and network to help with almost anything you need.

Not only do health care practices face the challenges of being a business, but they have to deal with malpractice concerns and 10,000 laws and regulations as healthcare providers as well.

Most often I meet at my client’s office so they are not spending otherwise productive time travelling.  My responsive concierge program provides certainty in legal costs, working on a flat fee retainer basis. No one cares more about their clients than I do. My clients can reach me virtually anytime and anywhere. I have negotiated contracts from the top of a mountain in Colorado on a Saturday night while skiing.

We start where you are in your business. Whether it is formation, negotiating contracts, buying or selling, or dispute resolution. My philosophy is to help you do business, to provide you with a road map to success. I help you focus on the big picture while effectively mitigating risks at every level of business, as well as being there to provide representation when and if it is needed. 

Most of my clients had not previously considered the benefits of a concierge attorney arrangement. Please give me a call at 239 220-3326 or send an email to bruce@brucevanderlaan.com, and we can arrange to discuss how and why this might be a perfect solution for your legal needs.

column69: M&A advisor with Mertz Taggart,  in the Home Health, Hospice, Home Care, and Behavioral Health industries.  Helping agency owners successfully plan their exit and achieve their best value. column104:
Exit Planning Strategist
Company Name
NAVIX Consultants 
Dates Employed
Oct 2018 – Present 
Employment Duration
2 mos 
Location
Fort Myers, Florida Area 
For over 20 years the nationwide NAVIX team has helped business owners prepare for and achieve a happy, successful exit. Exits include selling to partners or employees as well as an oustide party, passing a business to a family member, and planned liquidations. 

Our clients tell us that planning today for tomorrow’s exit helped them:

♦ Gain financial freedom apart from the business 
♦ Resolve intractable issues with co-owners and family members
♦ Identify and increase the value drivers for their business
♦ Increase control over the timing and terms of their exit
♦ Make better decisions and avoid costly mistakes

Please use our free assessments and best-practice guides at www.NAVIXconsultants.com. 

Please also schedule a free consultation with Bruce by email at Bruce@mertztaggart.com.
column139: As an concierge services attorney / lawyer, I help protect my clients in business and healthcare / medical practices as their Chief Legal Officer.  I work on a monthly retainer basis so my clients know what their legal fees are going to be, and don't get an unpleasant surprise.  I am available whenever they need me to call, email, listen, and solve problems.  They can call without getting another bill, and make the right, informed, decision. My firm provides exceptional customer service through this unique and cost effective concierge-type program. From small businesses to large healthcare and medical practices, each client’s goals and needs frame how we work together. My services include business attorney, health attorney, medical practice attorney, malpractice protection for firms who desire exceptional customer service and responsiveness, solutions to their legal challenges, and controlled legal fee expenses.

column611:
🌟 Exciting News!🌟

I’m thrilled to announce that I’ve been appointed President & CEO of First National Bank Coastal Community, a privately-held financial institution with locations in South Florida and Georgia.  

I’m looking forward to leading this incredible team of community bankers as we execute our expansion plans.   Together, we will build on the strong foundation already established and create something truly special.

I want to extend my heartfelt gratitude to William Penney for allowing me the opportunity to serve as Chief Lending Officer at Marine Bank for the past seven years.  We had a great run!  The knowledge and experience I gained will undoubtedly play a crucial role in the journey ahead.  

Of course, I will miss my amazing team.  There are too many of you to name, but your dedication and hard work directly contributed to making this possible.  Thank you for everything—I won’t forget it.  

Another special thank you to Alex Sanchez for encouraging me to think big and consider the possibility of leading my own bank someday. You planted that seed many years ago, and that day has finally arrived—next cafecito is on me!

I’m also excited to rejoin the Florida Bankers Association and begin collaborating with Kathy Kraninger and her team on banking issues that impact Main Street.  I can’t wait to see everyone at the FBA Annual Convention in June.  We’ve got work to do.  

Here’s to new beginnings!  🚀

#CommunityBanking #Leadership #Management #CCIM #CertifiedMortgageBanker

column1:
Creating and growing the Amida brand has been my sole passion and purpose since 2013. The birth of Amida Wealth, followed by Amida Business Management and Amida Lifestyle has been deeply influenced by my parent’s commitment to positively impacting people’s lives. As a child, I traveled throughout South America and spent summers at camps my father created. It wasn’t until I was grown and in the business world that I realized how much his entrepreneurial spirit influenced the creation of my life canvas and the eventual birth of Amida Wealth. 

A few life lessons I carry with me even today:
• The value of practicing self-care is a lasting impression from my years in the wellness industry.
• The importance of service to others was honed while I was in the hospitality world.
• And from my parents, find a vision, pursue your passions, and follow a path – always leaving our world a little better than we found it.

Amida Wealth and the values I share with my clients are my gift to the world. My years in corporate America inspired me to question the status quo and re-imagine a new way of being. As the founder, I am now re-creating what wealth management can truly become for my clients. It is my firm belief that wealth should be much more than investments and returns. True wealth can serve as the palm tree in an oasis…respite in life. 

Amida embodies the vision of true wealth - a place where, yes, we grow our money through proper investments, tax and legacy strategies but in a way that also provides an enlightening and distinctive experience; a place that allows you to bring harmony into all the areas of life and therefore help you transform your vision of wealth. 

I invite those who approach life with optimism and curiosity to connect with me to Transform YOUR VISION OF WEALTH®
column69:
Welcome to Amida Wealth. Welcome to True Wealth. We are creating a canvas of prosperity, combining freedom and money spaciousness into harmonious fusion of the elements of wealth. Our mission is to transform your vision of wealth and empower you to utilize your resources to thrive in your life and to enhance the lives of your loved ones. This is the essence of true wealth.

DISCLOSURES/LEGAL
Securities and Advisory Services offered through United Planners Financial Services, member FINRA/SIPC. Amida Wealth Advisors LLC and United Planners Financial Services are not affiliated. CA Insurance License No.0F32407

Miami, FL 33127

column104: Responsibilities include end to end transaction advisory including deal sourcing, execution, structuring, closure and relationship management.
column139:
Responsibilities span from deal sourcing to execution, leading to deal closure.  

This covers various aspects of Business Development including formation of a BD strategy based on macro indicators, formation of target segment of companies and investors to be approached and finally securing a mandate to advise on execution of various corporate options.

The mandate execution involves spending time with the top management to understand their strategy and growth imperatives and sharing feedback on the same. Preparation of the Business Plan / Information Memorandum in an investor friendly way.  Carrying out other execution activities like suitable partner search, valuation, negotiation support, due diligence support, feedback on various agreements and structuring of the transaction. 

Responsible for developing the IT/Technology vertical from scratch. Developed relationships in the IT industry covering most of the large and mid-sized IT/BPO companies and Technology focused funds.  Built upon the industry knowledge by having regular interactions with various industry people.  Developed an understanding of strategies and imperatives for different types of organizations within the sector.  Worked towards ensuring a healthy deal flow for most of the major relationships, which helped in subsequent winning of mandates.  

Other activities:

-	Written a research paper on IT and BPO sector Deal Outlook for 2009

-	Delivered a presentation on M&A landscape in India with a focus on technology sector at a conference in Israel

-	Prepared a case study, which got published in Acquisitions Monthly, a Reuters publication.

-	Represented the organization at Global M&A conferences in Dubai and Vienna        


Press Coverage:

column453:
As CEO of the Florida International Bankers Association (FIBA), I worked with Teresa Foxx while she was the Chair of the FIBA Board, as well as during her 6 years as a FIBA Board Member. She has always been vested in the success of FIBA and a tremendous supporter of the mission.  Teresa has been actively involved with the management team to shape the strategic direction of the organization and promote advocacy for the international banking community.  She was also instrumental in establishing the FIBA Women’s Leadership Committee and the FIBA Women on Boards of Director’s Program.    
 
Teresa’s governance and direction is highly regarded by the FIBA Board of Directors.  She is collaborative and diplomatic, with the ability to make difficult decisions.  She also willingly provides insights on her areas of expertise and seeks input from Management, as well as the Board.  Teresa’s board leadership has been extremely beneficial for FIBA.  I highly recommend her for both non-profit and corporate Boards of Directors.

Sincerely,

 

David Schwartz

column1:
A hands-on experienced senior executive with a successful background in commercial real estate, private equity, capital raising and financial restructuring for developers and sponsors. Primarily focused on identifying and interacting with potential clients who are seeking to buy or sell commercial real estate assets in the dynamic South Florida market. 

As a licensed commercial real estate advisor, I provide consulting, sales, leasing and marketing services to commercial property owners and buyers in the South Florida region and nationwide. Key expertise includes market analysis, client negotiation, risk assessment, and representing my clients in all types of transactions. I thrive in collaborative environments where teamwork, creativity, and innovation flourish. As a leader, I foster a culture of mutual respect, open communication, and continuous learning, empowering my team to reach new heights of excellence.
column69:
MCG Realty Advisors is a top commercial real estate brokerage specializing in the acquisition and advisory of multifamily assets, development land, industrial properties, and office and retail portfolios. 

As Managing Director, I oversee our comprehensive brokerage and advisory services and lead our business development and client services divisions. Our team comprises senior real estate and capital markets professionals with extensive experience and a strategically aligned network that amplifies client success.

From complex development projects to multifamily portfolio acquisitions, MCG has a proven track record of structuring deals that enhance profitability and long-term value. Our expertise across all commercial real estate sectors, combined with market insight and deep local knowledge, enables us to provide unparalleled investment and advisory services tailored to each client’s needs.

Core Specialties include:

Multifamily Assets: Skilled in identifying value-add opportunities, stabilizing assets, and boosting portfolio performance to maximize ROI.

Land for Development: Expertise in securing top development sites and navigating zoning, entitlement, and market demand complexities.

Industrial Properties: Comprehensive understanding of the logistics and infrastructure that drive South Florida’s industrial market.

Office and Retail Portfolios: Strategic insights into portfolio diversification, space utilization, and market trends that add value to office and retail investments.
column104: Madison Capital Group, LLC is a real estate investment and merchant banking firm based in Miami, Florida. The firm has extensive experience in all property types including multifamily, office, retail, self-storage, hospitality, mixed use, and industrial. We offer a broad range of financial and transactional capabilities to owners of existing or to-be-developed properties and land suitable for these types of projects.
column139: Apex Capital Realty is a full-service real estate brokerage based in Miami, Florida. Specializing in the sale, acquisition, and leasing of properties in the urban core of Miami, the Apex team is comprised of some of the region’s most experienced commercial real estate professionals. Focus areas include multi-family and mixed-use assets, development sites, industrial properties as well as retail, office, and hospitality spaces for a host of private real estate developers, landlords, institutional investors, and high net-worth individuals.
column169:
The Florida Alternative Investment Association (FLAIA) is a not-for-profit 501 (c) (6) trade organization created to establish Florida as a leading center internationally for Alternative Investment management. Members come from the world of Real Estate, Private Equity, Hedge Funds, Portfolio Management, Fund Allocation and Family Offices.

My role as Chief Marketing Officer was to facilitate involvement among the regions civic, governmental and business leaders as well as advance the mission of Florida's Alternative Investment cluster. With an emphasis on the Real Estate, Direct Lending and Financial Services sectors, FLAIA is the preeminent membership organization in the region for individuals looking to meet and interact on a regular basis.

Driven to be of service to my community, to my network, and my clients, because I value the power in connecting challenges to solutions. 

I believe  in collaboration, and the empowerment of others in order to maintain high productivity and performance within a team and organization. 

As the pace of change in buying behavior accelerates, I am a trusted resource for executives to stay ahead of the curve, by providing access to the right intel, solutions and network.  Purpose-driven with a genuine inner passion to be a bridge that provides direct, and efficient access to solutions.   

My specialty is crafting outcome-focused B2B events, that provide access to world-class research and cutting-edge intelligence solutions. I am dedicated to helping businesses meet the challenges posed by the fast-moving, disruptive business environment by creating environments that foster innovative brainstorming and masterminding. 

Whether it’s brokering real solutions to existing or upcoming business projects, providing greater insight into emerging trends and their outcomes, or helping clients cut through the noise of a crowded  vendor marketplace, my experience working with executives, and business owners across the country provides the network and information you need to make projects a success.

Disruption is happening. Business is changing. And having the right combination of intel, timing, and influencers is the new imperative. 

"The natural desire of good men is knowledge."- Leonardo da Vinci

Besides staying up to date with disruptive technologies and innovative marketing strategy, I am an avid hiker and adventure traveler, public speaker, recreational soccer player, and an uncle to 15 beautiful nieces and nephews.

column69:
Group supporting various business line's technology implementing new platform in Scala 3 with ZIO 2.x for a microservices environment replacing legacy M/F processing. Work involves a wide variety of updates or additions to REST endpoints, wiring components together or testing ranging from unit, component testing to live dependency testing. Initial work involved migration from Scala 2 to 3 and ZIO 1.x to 2.x. Updates to previous release levels necessitated creating foundational  components for new levels. Development is done locally or in AWS cloud leveraging numerous services. Testing tooling involved interaction with python scripts and/or go lang services. Performance testing done displaying results in various dashboards in New Relic, Splunk or Observe.

Environment: Scala, ZIO, DynamoDB, AWS, sbt, git, jenkins, Cucumber
column139:
Narrow Temporal Window Stream Correlations

Working on a analytics solution that is Stream oriented. Primarily to bring out Stream (Event) correlations based on 'terms that span across disparate schema ' in a spectrum on different Streams.

Built on Akka that is used to define and bring together the disparate processes. Visualizations are websockets driven using Play.

The solution is useful and focused when working with predictive models across disparate streams within very narrow near real-time temporal windows. Examples being in advertising, healthcare, trading, logistics and emergency management.

In-memory models is a primary driver.

The platforms uses JDK 8 , Scala 2.10.4, Apache Spark 1.3 – Spark Streaming. Akka 2.3.9 , Akka Streams, Netty 4.0.26, Kafka 0.8.2.1 and Play 2.3.8

Work group enhancing internal systems in which insurance issuers upload their plans to be vetted for healthcare.gov.
    • Created and enhanced REST endpoints to port functionality from legacy to modernized system using highly functional Scala proprietary flows across a set of microservices built on Play Framework. Flows are json based requests which generate xml responses from AWS S3 data sources or database. Some flows originate from UI as well as via message publishing system using AWS SQS. ScalaTest is used for unit testing and integration testing is done with proprietary scripts testing messaging and services interactions.
    • Created proof of concept application to generate input xml for New Relic monitoring.
Environment: Scala, Play, Akka, gradle, sbt, PostGresSQL, Redis, git, jenkins, AWS

Bob is a seasoned financial services leader with a proven track record of strategic growth, sales leadership, and forging successful partnerships.

In his current role, Bob oversees Product Management, Product Development, and Relationship Management; driving innovation and expanding partnerships with broker-dealers and wealth management firms. Previously, as National Sales Manager at InspereX, he led the firm’s wholesaling team in the distribution of structured products, playing a key role in business growth and market expansion.

Before joining InspereX (formerly Incapital), Bob served as Senior Vice President and Head of Relationship Management at F-Squared Investments, where he led the National Key Account Management, Platform Sales, and Global Client Service teams. His leadership was instrumental in strengthening strategic partnerships and expanding the firm’s distribution footprint.

Bob was also a founding partner of Orinda Asset Management, where he served as Principal of the Capital Markets Group. At Orinda, he contributed to the successful launch of two liquid alternative investment solutions, pioneering the placement of hedge fund strategies within the retail mutual fund market.

Earlier in his career, Bob spent 16 years at Putnam Investments, where he was consistently recognized as a top-performing wholesaler. He played a pivotal role in launching the Insurance Investment-Only sales team and was also involved in distributing institutional money market products.

Bob holds a Bachelor of Arts in Political Science from Providence College and maintains Series 7, 24, and 63 licenses, along with a Florida insurance license.

As a former corporate CEO, business owner, and now M&A Adviser/Business Broker, I provide expert business valuation and advisory services to assist business owners to prepare and sell their business to the right buyer for the best price in a confidential manner. I have over 20 years of CEO experience in M&A, business brokerage, and executive search, based on my own entrepreneurial journey and corporate background in various industries and markets.

I understand the challenges and opportunities of running and exiting a business, and I leverage my insights, skills, and network to make the process smooth and successful for my clients. I specialize in exit planning, business valuation, deal structuring, negotiation, and due diligence, and I have a proven track record of closing multiple deals across different sectors and regions. I can work with clients in English, Spanish, and Danish, and I have a passion for learning and sharing best practices in M&A and business ownership.

column1:
Mr Dumke is the founder and Managing Member of Cloudbreak Capital, LLC; an entity focused on LBO and MBO transactions in the United States in manufacturing, distribution, and services. In this capacity, he serves as the Chairman of Vortex Engineering, LLC, a full-service metal fabrication company and VCC Optoelectronics, a pioneer in solid-state lighting and indication products.  Previously, prior to their sale, Mr Dumke served on the on the boards of TCHO Ventures, Timely Medical Innovations, LLC, and other CloudBreak investments.

  Prior to CloudBreak, Mr Dumke was chairman, CEO and co-founder of Avexus, Inc, a software 500 provider of SasS and enterprise software lifecycle management solutions to the global aerospace and defense industry. Avexus solutions were chosen by Boeing, GE, BBA, USN, Goodrich and other tier 1 A&D firms as core lifecycle and profitability management solutions. 

  Prior to Avexus, Mr. Dumke was a General Partner with PMF, a private investment firm specializing in acquiring, financing and building companies. PMF successfully financed and sold (through strategic sale or an Initial Public Offering) several companies in the software, telecommunications, and Web eCommerce markets. During his tenure, Mr. Dumke personally sourced, structured, negotiated and monitored investments in GA Express, Brainstorm Networks and Assist Cornerstone Technologies. In addition, he was jointly responsible for investments in Respond, LightOptronics and DataWorks/Epicor.  
Before joining PMF, Mr. Dumke founded Wave Software, a company that designed, programmed and successfully licensed a series of financial applications for Windows. 

  Mr. Dumke has three children. He lives in Fort Lauderdale, Florida and enjoys skiing, golf, flying, cooking, art, and playing with his kids. He is an instrument, multi engine fixed wing and rotary aircraft pilot type rated in Citation C500 and Embraer E55P turbojet aircraft. 

Specialties: Defense, Aerospace, Mergers, Finance, medical products

column1:
With a career dedicated to unlocking U.S. real estate opportunities for international and domestic investors, I’ve had the privilege of leading The Q Kapital Group Corp as CEO & Founder—positioning the firm as one of the top mortgage companies specializing in foreign national loans.

At Q Kapital, we have successfully funded over $8 billion in residential and commercial loans, providing financing solutions tailored to the unique needs of foreign nationals and U.S. citizens alike. From luxury condos in Miami to investment properties in Orlando, Houston, Colorado, and New York, our team has developed a proven expertise in navigating complex transactions with speed, clarity, and personalized service.

But the mission goes beyond mortgages—it’s about building long-term value for our clients and being a reliable partner in their journey to wealth creation through U.S. real estate.

In parallel, I proudly serve as Founder & Board Member of Nexos Invest, a private lending platform created to deliver fast, secure, and structured financing solutions to high-net-worth individuals, developers, and real estate investors. With over $500 million in private capital placed, Nexos Invest fills a vital gap in the market, offering flexible lending where traditional institutions fall short.

Both companies reflect my commitment to excellence, innovation, and trust—whether it’s helping a first-time international buyer secure their first U.S. property or structuring a multimillion-dollar private loan for a commercial project.

If you’re an investor, developer, realtor, or family office looking for strategic financing solutions—or want to explore how we can collaborate—let’s connect.

We speak your language. We understand your challenges. And we know how to get deals done.
column8: Q Kapital Group | Residential & Commercial Mortgage Loans

column48: As a professional architect, I specialize in working at construction sites, managing budgets, and collaborating with construction lenders. column69:
At QKapital, we excel in providing tailored mortgage solutions for both Foreign National and Domestic Investors in the USA. With over $8 billion funded, including a significant portion dedicated to Foreign Nationals, we have established ourselves as leaders in the industry. Our expertise spans residential, commercial, private, and construction loans, ensuring we cater to the diverse needs of our clients.

Our dedicated team of professionals is committed to negotiating the best available mortgage loans, leveraging our extensive network and deep understanding of the market. We specialize in assisting investors from South/Central America, Canada, and Europe, adeptly navigating the complexities of cross-border transactions and local regulations.

Our mission is to simplify the mortgage process, providing seamless, efficient, and transparent service. At QKapital, we believe in building lasting relationships with our clients, offering personalized guidance and unwavering support every step of the way.

Let’s connect and explore how we can help you achieve your investment goals with confidence.

#MortgageLender #ForeignInvestments #USRealEstate #InvestmentLoans #CrossBorderTransactions
column104:
At Nexos Invest, we offer a unique opportunity for investors to participate in our portfolio of loan offerings. As a Board Member, I am proud to be part of a team that not only provides tailored financial solutions but also empowers investors to grow their wealth through secure, asset-backed investments.

Nexos is a licensed private lender based in Florida, specializing in both commercial and residential investment properties across key markets such as Miami, Florida, and beyond. Our focus is on delivering fast, reliable, and personalized lending services that cater to the unique needs of international and domestic investors.

In addition to our competitive loan products, our investment opportunities allow investors to diversify their portfolios while benefiting from the attractive returns associated with real estate lending. This dual approach allows us to serve both those seeking financing and those looking to invest in solid, asset-backed opportunities.

Our team is dedicated to working closely with clients and investors to understand their goals and provide solutions that align with their financial strategies.

As part of my role, I am involved in overseeing strategic initiatives, expanding our market presence, and ensuring that our services and investment opportunities remain at the forefront of the industry. By leveraging our expertise and innovative approaches, Nexos Invest continues to empower investors to achieve their real estate ambitions and grow their wealth through participation in our loan investments.

We are committed to building long-term relationships with our clients and investors, founded on trust, transparency, and mutual success. If you’re looking for a lending partner who understands the intricacies of investment properties and offers opportunities to invest in secure loans, Nexos Invest is your go-to resource.

column626:
El atractivo de Florida como un imán para inversionistas extranjeros continúa creciendo, estableciéndose como una de las mejores elecciones para quienes buscan oportunidades sólidas y rentables en el mercado inmobiliario estadounidense.

Con un entorno regulador favorable y un mercado que ofrece tanto diversidad como potencial de apreciación, Florida no es solo un destino vacacional sino también un centro clave para inversiones estratégicas. La accesibilidad en la compra de propiedades y las condiciones de financiamiento competitivas como las que ofrecemos, facilitan el camino para aquellos que buscan maximizar sus rendimientos mientras disfrutan de la seguridad jurídica y económica que ofrece el estado.

En QKapital, entendemos las necesidades de los inversionistas internacionales y ofrecemos soluciones personalizadas que aseguran no solo la compra eficiente de propiedades sino también la optimización de su valor a largo plazo. Nuestra experiencia y profundo conocimiento del mercado local nos permite guiar a cada cliente a través de un proceso simplificado, asegurando que cada inversión sea tan transparente como rentable.

Contáctenos hoy para descubrir cómo puede comenzar su viaje de inversión en uno de los mercados más dinámicos de los Estados Unidos. Estamos aquí para abrirle las puertas a nuevas oportunidades y asegurar que su inversión inmobiliaria alcance su máximo potencial.
Escribe la palabra LUJO y te enviaremos la guía del inversionista para que sepas como empezar a invertir de manera inteligente en bienes raíces en Estados Unidos.

#InversiónInmobiliaria #FloridaRealEstate #QKapital #MercadoInmobiliario #OportunidadesDeInversión
column641:
La inversión extranjera en bienes raíces en Estados Unidos, especialmente en Florida, representa un segmento significativo del mercado, con un 23% del total de las inversiones internacionales. Este atractivo no es casualidad: la combinación de un entorno económico estable, una vibrante diversidad cultural y un clima acogedor colocan a Florida y estados como Texas y California en el centro de la atención global.

En Florida, donde se alojan inversionistas de países como Colombia y Argentina, y en Texas, con su economía sólida y atractiva para los mexicanos, las oportunidades son especialmente prometedoras. Incluso en California, la constante evolución del sector inmobiliario sigue atrayendo capital extranjero. 

Sin embargo, es crucial entender que las oportunidades varían significativamente entre diferentes regiones.

En QKapital, no solo facilitamos el financiamiento de estas inversiones con soluciones hipotecarias ajustadas a las necesidades de cada cliente, sino que también ofrecemos asesoramiento experto para maximizar el retorno sobre estas inversiones. Te invitamos a explorar cómo podemos ayudarte a realizar inversiones estratégicas que fortalezcan tu portafolio.

Dejame un comentario para agendar una consulta y descubrir cómo tus inversiones pueden prosperar en el vibrante mercado inmobiliario de EE. UU.
column654:
Desde Medellín hacia nuevas oportunidades en USA 

Hola a todos, ¡saludos desde Medellín! Llevo casi 10 días en Colombia, moviéndome entre Cartagena, Bogotá, y ahora Medellín, compartiendo cómo los colombianos pueden invertir en bienes raíces en EE. UU. 🏙️🌟

Aquí en QKapital, no solo ofrecemos asesoramiento, sino que abrimos puertas a oportunidades increíbles de inversión sin necesidad de visa o ciudadanía estadounidense. Desde casas y apartamentos hasta centros comerciales y terrenos, hay un abanico de opciones para que los colombianos puedan expandir su patrimonio apalancándose de los bancos americanos.

Descubre cómo puedes utilizar el apalancamiento de los bancos para maximizar tus inversiones! Deja un comentario para agendar un café virtual o presencial y hablar más sobre tus opciones de inversión. 🚀

📌 Estamos no solo en Miami y Orlando, sino también en cinco países de Latinoamérica.

💬 ¡Hablemos!

#InversionesEnUSA #QKapital #RealEstateInvesting #Medellín #Colombia #InvierteEnUSA #EmprendedoresColombianos
column667:
El mercado inmobiliario de los Estados Unidos es una joya oculta para muchos inversores internacionales. Su crecimiento constante, robustez y rentabilidad lo convierten en una opción idónea para aquellos que buscan estabilidad y rendimiento.
Sabemos que estás buscando justamente eso: Una inversión sin riesgo que saque el máximo provecho de tus recursos.
En QKapital estamos listos para ayudarte a explorar las oportunidades que este mercado ofrece, maximizando tus ganancias y protegiendo tu patrimonio a largo plazo.
Etiqueta a quien necesite este consejo y déjanos tus comentarios.
¡En QKapital estamos listos para hacer crecer tu inversión!

column1: C. Lee Lobban is owner and principal of Diversified Property Specialists, Inc., a full service real estate appraisal and consulting firm located in Titusville, Florida.  He is a State Certified General Real Estate Appraiser and a member of the Appraisal Institute.  He personally oversees all appraisal work in the office and has been qualified as an expert witness in property valuation in the Counties of Duval, Marion, Seminole, Volusia, Orange, Osceola, Polk, Hillsborough, Duval, St. Johns, Putnam, Brevard and Lake.  He has been a real estate appraiser in the State of Florida since 1985.  Property types appraised include vacant land, wetlands, improved residential, subdivisions, commercial, industrial, institutional, marinas, hospitals, golf courses, special-use properties, outdoor advertising signs, whole and partial fee acquisitions, permanent easements, temporary easements, utility easements, gas line easements, land leases, air rights, conservation easements, navigation easements, subordination agreements, apportionment interests, cell towers, railroad right-of-ways, air rights, riparian rights, river bottoms, bridges, allocated fee rights and cell towers.
