column1:
Wealth Advisor at RFG Advisory | Kiplinger contributor.

As a former professional athlete, I’ve seen firsthand how quickly financial success can be undermined without the right guidance. That experience shaped my mission today: to help individuals and families avoid costly mistakes and make confident, informed decisions about their money.

As a dedicated Wealth Advisor, I bring the same focus, discipline, and drive from my athletic career into every client relationship. My approach is rooted in trust — built through transparency, consistent communication, and delivering on my word.

I prioritize accountability and availability, ensuring my clients always have a reliable partner to turn to. Education is a cornerstone of my process. I believe in simplifying complex financial topics and creating a clear connection between you and your investments, so you’re never in the dark about where your money is or how it’s working for you.

Whether you're planning for retirement, growing wealth, or just trying to simplify your financial life, I’ll work with you to build a strategy that’s as dynamic and resilient as your goals.

Let’s build a future with clarity, confidence, and a strong game plan — Winning, Together.


Securities offered by Registered Representatives of Private Client Services. Member FINRA / SIPC. Advisory services offered by Investment Advisory Representatives of RFG Advisory, a registered investment advisor. Private Client Services and RFG Advisory are unaffiliated entities. Advisory services are only offered to clients or prospective clients where RFG Advisory and its representatives are properly licensed or exempt from licensure. No advisory services may be rendered by RFG Advisory unless a client agreement is in place.

column104:
Helping Athletes, Entertainers and Families preserve their income through strategic financial planning. Our goal is to bridge the gap between playing and retirement so that our clients can live the lifestyle they have come accustom to living.

Our Focus:
- Asset Protection and Properly Structured Asset Allocation Strategies
- Risk Management & Mitigation Strategies—Assessment and Implementation
- Private Asset and Principal Protected Methods & Portfolio Management
- Entity/Estate Planning & Titling of Assets—Current Ownership and Beneficiary Designations
- Income Tax Minimization Strategies and Burden/Allocation Planning

A vast number of players never think about putting money away while they’re playing and in certain cases, it’s far too late to play catch up.  Through the years, we’ve heard countless players express concern of the day the lucrative checks stop coming in and we get asked, ”What can I do now?” Our answer is always “Get Started Now”. By creating an asset protection plan and retirement income strategy, we can effectively bridge the gap between the last days of playing and when it comes time to pull from your well-deserved pension fund.

The Sports & Entertainment Division of Global Wealth Management provides personalized, coordinated financial planning and asset protection strategies for professional athletes & entertainers, addressing their tax, investment, insurance, estate and overall wealth management needs. By dissecting the top three areas of most concern—Traditional Asset Protection Strategies, Transparent Institutional-Based Investment Management, and Seamless Generational Wealth Transfer—our experienced team of professional financial advisors guides athletes through the various transitional phases of their life, from amateur to professional, to potential career transition and ultimately, retirement—and puts a plan in place that allows professional athletes to convert their career earnings into a legacy of financial stability.

With over 25 years of international experience in real estate, I am a passionate, driven leader and entrepreneur in the industry. column611:
Este año ha sido de transformación, introspección y decisiones importantes. Dentro de este proceso de reflexión, decidí darme un regalo especial e invertir en mí, mientras me reconectaba con Colombia desde una perspectiva diferente.
La semana pasada fui muy feliz de graduarme del Curso de Liderazgo de Mujeres en Juntas Directivas, liderado por el Centro de Estudios en Gobierno Corporativo - CESA. Fue una experiencia profundamente enriquecedora, llena de aprendizajes transformadores y la oportunidad de compartir con una comunidad de mujeres excepcionales que inspiran.
Quiero destacar el liderazgo ejemplar de Maria Andrea Trujillo y Alexander Guzmán, quienes están haciendo una labor extraordinaria al promover la conciencia colectiva sobre la importancia del liderazgo femenino y el empoderamiento intergeneracional en Colombia. Es motivador ver cómo iniciativas como estas están abriendo puertas y creando oportunidades para el futuro. Sin duda, este ha sido uno de los mejores regalos que me he dado este año, y me llena de entusiasmo seguir contribuyendo a construir espacios donde más mujeres puedan liderar y generar impacto.

Adriana Mora Corredor, Guiovanna Maria Silva Duarte, Lina Marcela Baron Fonseca, Maria Claudia Carrizosa Bayón, María Lucía Pérez Ramírez, Natalia Marín Ramírez, Sandra Jaramillo A., Cristina Carvajal, Camila Ayala Alvarez, Angélica Peña P., Biviana Argüelles Perdomo, Natalia Marín Ramírez, Ana María Pesantes S., Ana Claudia Alvarez, Y las que me quedan!!!

"This year has been one of transformation, introspection, and important decisions. As part of this reflective process, I decided to give myself a special gift: investing in myself while reconnecting with Colombia from a different perspective.
Last week, I was thrilled to graduate from the Women’s Leadership in Boards Course, led by the Center for Corporate Governance Studies - CESA. It was a profoundly enriching experience, filled with transformative learning and the opportunity to connect with a community of exceptional women who inspire.
I want to highlight the exemplary leadership of María Andrea Trujillo and Alexander Guzmán, who are doing extraordinary work in fostering collective awareness about the importance of female leadership and intergenerational empowerment in Colombia. It is truly inspiring to see how initiatives like these are opening doors and creating opportunities for the future. Without a doubt, this has been one of the best gifts I have given myself this year, and I am filled with enthusiasm to continue contributing to creating spaces where more women can lead and make an impact."

Estoy muy feliz de cerrar el año con grandes cambios y la oportunidad de moderar este panel para GRI Club Latam con la participacion de Adriana Hurtado Uriarte, Alberto Bessoudo Sustiel, Felipe Toro, Jose Ruben Velarde, Josef Preschel 


Tomorrow we will be with a group of experts in the Latin American Real Estate market, discussing the projections for LATAM, the challenging moments we are currently experiencing, and how creativity, discipline, and consistency can help us navigate the storm and seize opportunities.
I am very happy to close the year with significant changes and the opportunity to moderate this panel for GRI Club Latam

column1:
🎙️ Podcast Host | 🌟 Mortgage Industry Leader | 🚀 Loan Officer Growth Specialist | 📚 Best-Selling Author | 🎤 Stand-Up Comic

As a driven leader in the mortgage industry, I’ve successfully built and grown a high-performing team of over 100 employees, achieving nearly $1 billion in annual closed volume. My passion lies in helping individuals and families achieve homeownership while mentoring and empowering loan officers to reach their full potential.

📚 Best-Selling Author: My book, “Oprah Winfrey Can’t Make a Cold Call: 16 Quotes That Helped Enhance My Sales Career,” shares insights, strategies, and personal lessons that have shaped my professional journey.

🎧 Podcast Host: Sharing insights, success stories, and industry tips, my podcast is where real conversations meet actionable advice. Whether you’re in the industry or aspiring to be, tune in for inspiration and growth.

🎤 Stand-Up Comic: Bringing humor to the stage, I enjoy making people laugh and finding the lighter side of life.

🚤 Avid Boater: Whether cruising the waters or soaking in sunsets, boating is one of my greatest passions.

🏈 Philadelphia Sports Fan: A proud supporter of Philly sports teams, I thrive on the energy and excitement that only die-hard fans can understand.

Beyond the office, the stage, and the water, I thrive on connecting with like-minded professionals, exploring new adventures through travel, and enjoying life’s finer moments with family, friends, and great wine.

Let’s connect and collaborate! Together, we can elevate the mortgage industry, inspire new talent, and create meaningful impact.

🌍 Explore. Connect. Succeed.

John Kaneklides is an owner and co-founder at The Audit Library. John manages teams to perform assurance consulting engagements, develops risk-based audit plans, and creates custom audit governing documents for credit unions.

In addition to his consulting work, John was an Audit Senior at a $1 Billion credit union and brings first-hand knowledge to benefit his clients. He has worked directly with credit union executive management on various department audit and policy consulting engagements. John assisted in analyzing risks and developing annual audit plans to ensure resources were appropriately allocated. He also served in an advisory capacity on the Board of Directors’ Asset Liability Committee.

A dedicated advocate for the internal audit industry, John served as the Academic Relations Coordinator for the Charlotte, North Carolina Chapter of the Institute of Internal Auditors for 5 years. In this role, John spoke regularly at area universities, and managed a team of volunteers in creating events that brought students and professional Internal Auditors together to help increase visibility to the profession. In addition to his auditing career, John is a nationally recognized singer and regularly performs in New York and around the country.

John holds a Bachelor of Science and a Masters Degree from Winthrop University. He is a Certified Internal Auditor (CIA), and lives in New York City

column1:
As the Founder and CEO of Green Check Verified, I lead a team of smart and passionate people who are on a mission to connect the cannabis and banking industries using technology that removes barriers and fuels business growth. With over six years of experience in this highly regulated and complex domain, I have developed a deep expertise and a strong network of strategic partners and investors.

My core competencies include new business development, customer relationship management, strategy, and organizational development. I have successfully launched and scaled a SaaS platform that works within the banking industry, not around it, for the cannabis industry, delivering value to both sides of the equation. I have also built and led a diverse and high-performing sales organization that has secured multiple large contracts and increased user retention. I am driven by the vision of creating synergy and innovation through mobile technology and data.
column57: Graduate Courses, Business Administration, Management and Operations
column79:
The cannabis and banking industries need to work together, but they don’t know how. Green Check connects these two highly regulated industries using technology that removes barriers and fuels business growth.

We started with this idea in 2016 - how can we develop a scalable platform that works within the banking industry, not around it, for the cannabis industry?

After 3 years of ideation, countless meetings with industry executives and knowledge experts, a healthy SAFE round with strategic investors and then hiring a team of really smart people, we have built a SaaS platform for the enablement of real banking relationships within the cannabis industry.  We have spent thousands of hours on the development of the entire platform as we gear up for our national launch in 2019.

Our patent pending platform has been vetted by a wide variety of individuals all along the way.  From dispensary owners, growers, state regulatory agencies, bank compliance officers, BSA personnel, federal and state financial examiners and a host of technology experts.  Our national board of advisors, a group of unmatched professionals across the industry touch points, has been integral to our preparation and development.
column104:
We create and advance innovative uses of mobile platforms based on real-world business demands.

We strive for synergy when we build a mobile approach for our customers. When leveraged correctly – or in other words, contiguously – mobile technology can truly transform businesses. We aim to enable our customers to capitalize on new and innovative mobile technology to create  that synergy, leading to increased productivity and transparency, an improved employee and user experience, and a clearer path to accomplish business objectives.

column169:
The founders had built a successful business but they recognized the need for new leadership to grow the company to the "next level".  The company had a core customer base of individual users & SMBs along with some corporate customers.  The revenue stream was comprised almost exclusively with hardware sales, the lowest gross margin category.  My charter was to grow the business, increase profitability, and figure out how to take the significant local brand equity & leverage that identity nationally while retaining the culture that had been developed over the years. 

Grew revenue from $80m in 2010 to $115m in 2013 with the same headcount (205) while improving gross margin over 2%

Defined & put in place leadership team for the company. Hired VP Sales, VP Services, Director Product Merchandising, Director Retail, Director of Training.  Also mentored & promoted internal personnel to CTO, Director Marketing and Manager of Customer Service

Hired a CFO, first for the company, who assisted in developing tighter operational controls and processes including yearly departmental level budgets for the owners and BOD

Defined the right processes, procedures & people to make sure Tekserve achieved Apple's highest designation of customer service, Premier Service Provider. The elite classification for Apple customer satisfaction of customer service & product support

Selected by Apple to be a member of their reseller board to provide input, feedback & ideas to Apple based on customer experience within the reseller community 

Appointed by Apple to be the chair of the services committee to assist Apple's senior leadership in the development & roll-out of best practices for new services initiatives, iOS, as well as repair practices within the reseller community

Developed the relationships with Apple's enterprise sale teams and Tekserve's corporate customers to close sales including large iOS deployments for OTG and Cablevision

Sought after speaker for Apple product announcements

As Chief Operating Officer at AdventHealth Credit Union, I lead a diverse portfolio of strategic functions—including sales, lending, digital banking, compliance, operations, and marketing. With over two decades of experience in the banking and credit union industry, I bring a strong blend of innovation, strategic vision, and operational excellence to every initiative I undertake.

Throughout my career, I’ve been passionate about transforming the member experience, driving sustainable growth, and building high-performing teams. At AdventHealth Credit Union, I’ve led the successful implementation of several key initiatives including a user-friendly mobile app, an AI-powered chatbot, a performance-based incentive program, and an auto-decisioning loan origination system—resulting in improved engagement, streamlined operations, and faster service delivery.

What drives me is a commitment to mission, impact, and innovation. I believe in the power of credit unions to change lives, and I work every day to ensure our teams are equipped, inspired, and aligned to do just that.

As I continue to grow as a leader, I’m focused on expanding my impact and preparing for new challenges where I can help organizations lead with purpose, embrace innovation, and navigate meaningful transformation.

Report directly to leadership team including CEO, CFO, CCO, and Board President while managing daily operations, employees and transactions of firm and parent company. Oversee broker-dealer operations including human resources, contract negotiations, vendor management (including IT), and developing profitable strategic partnerships. Set vision for team and ensure department heads have necessary resources to accomplish revenue growth and profit objectives. Play key role in streamlining processes that reduce overhead expenses and eliminate redundancies.

KEY ACCOMPLISHMENTS
• Reduced over $2.5M in expenses/overhead within one year by identifying inefficient operations and vendor relationships at critical time for company leading to reduced burn rate and positive cash flow for firm
• Netted $500K increase in fee-based revenue to firm by partnering with legal department to back-bill for missed periods within 2-month period
• Conceptualized and implemented new broker-dealer commissions software, Castine, resulting in significant work efficiency and scalability improvements for brokers through automation of payroll and commissions processes
• Created new insurance entity (Dominari Financial Heritage Strategies, LLC) while ensuring proper licensing and registrations resulting in over $700K in revenue for firm and registered representatives
• Managed company’s clearing firm migration from BNYMellon/Pershing to RBC by successfully coordinating complicated logistics, file and data migration with key parties including FINRA and others 
• Improved client account onboarding by implementing fully paperless process utilizing DocuPace within 4 months
• Hired and onboarded 35 brokers in less than 30 days by revamping onboarding workflow through simplified paperwork while eliminating redundancies

column1:
I am a seasoned real estate investment banking professional dedicated to delivering strategic insights, transaction expertise, and capital solutions to clients navigating the global property landscape. Currently serving as Managing Director, Partner at GFG Securities, LLC, I lead a team focused on real estate M&A, debt and capital raising, as well as buy/sell advisory for an international client base.

Prior to joining GFG in 2016, I honed my expertise managing institutional real estate portfolios at PGIM Real Estate in Mexico. There, I oversaw over $3 billion in assets under management—spanning major public REITs such as Terrafina and PRUMEX—ensuring optimized performance and robust, risk-adjusted returns.

Leveraging more than a decade of experience, I bring a blend of analytical rigor, market intelligence, and strategic deal execution to advance high-stakes transactions and long-term growth objectives for investors worldwide. Feel free to connect with me here on LinkedIn to explore opportunities, insights, and partnerships in the dynamic world of real estate investment.

column1:
With over 40 years of experience in investment banking, corporate finance, and private equity, I am the President & CEO, Partner, and Co-Founder of Pan American Finance. Our Miami-based firm specializes in M&A advisory and capital raising services, focusing on clean energy and sustainable infrastructure. Since 2003, we’ve successfully completed 87 transactions valued at over $5 billion, with more than $2.5 billion directed towards clean energy initiatives.

Previously, I served as CFO of Ibero American Media Partners, a $500 million private equity platform, and as Vice Chairman of Cisneros Television Group, where I played a key role in the merger with El Sitio, forming Claxson Interactive Group (NASDAQ: XSON) in 2001. I also held positions at Violy, Byorum & Partners, Citicorp Securities, and Continental Bank, gaining experience across New York, Los Angeles, Chicago, and London.
In addition to my professional pursuits, I am a director of the Osteosarcoma Collaborative and a senior advisor to the ALS Recovery Fund, both focused on advancing research and patient care for ALS and bone cancer. I graduated from St. Benet's Hall, University of Oxford.

I welcome opportunities to connect with fellow professionals in the investment banking and clean energy sectors.

column48: Activities and societies: St. Hugh's House
column69:
As President & CEO and co-founder of Pan American Finance, I drive the firm's strategic direction in providing M&A advisory, project finance, and capital raising services. With 40 years of industry experience, I focus on Renewable Energy, Infrastructure, Financial Services, and the Technology, Media, and Telecom sectors. I collaborate with businesses, asset managers, family offices, and institutional investors across the Americas and Europe, leveraging my deep transaction expertise to deliver value to clients.
Before co-founding Pan American, I served as Managing Director and CFO of a $500 million private equity platform and Vice Chairman of a leading media group, where I played a significant role in the successful merger that formed a publicly traded entity. My earlier positions include roles at prominent investment firms and banks. In addition to my professional responsibilities, I engage in philanthropic efforts as a director of a cancer research organization and a senior advisor to a fund focused on ALS patient care and research.

column1:
Liderando PayPhone durante más de una década, hemos convertido nuestra visión en una realidad tangible: una Fintech que lidera la inclusión financiera en América Latina. Nuestro equipo ha trabajado incansablemente para simplificar las interacciones financieras, empoderando a las personas a través de la tecnología y promoviendo un ecosistema sin efectivo.

Como Director en CITEC, mi enfoque está en impulsar la innovación tecnológica, uniendo a la industria para fomentar un entorno donde la colaboración y la vanguardia son la norma. Con habilidades en consultoría de gestión, análisis de negocios y planificación estratégica, me mantengo al frente de la transformación digital, siempre con el objetivo de generar un impacto duradero en la comunidad y la economía.
column57: Master of Business Administration (M.B.A.), Exchange program
column69:
Cofundador de lo que hoy conocemos como Payphone, una Fintech reconocida en Latinoamérica por su enfoque en la inclusión financiera y la simplificación de la relación entre las personas y el dinero.
Los cimientos de esta alucinante startup son el acceso a la libertad económica, la simplificación a través de lo digital, la autonomía en los procesos y la visión de un mundo sin dinero físico, sin comisiones y sin temor a la tecnología financiera.

column359:
For more than 15 years, National Transaction Corporation has been a strategic partner to the American Society of Travel Advisors. Travel agencies around the world depend on NTC to facilitate travel payment transactions, as well as related industries such as hotels, tour operators, car rentals and more. This year's award speaks largely to NTC’s exclusive payment platform NTC ePay, and the various features that Travel Advisors and even chapter organizers have come to appreciate. This year's award also marks the 3rd consecutive year of recognition by ASTA for technology and payment processing. NTC provides ASTA the mutual benefit of a revenue stream for the association while providing competitive rates and innovative payment integrations to ASTA members.

   NTC ePay is a platform to create payable links like Electronic Invoices, Social Media Posts with Integrated Payments and even e-commerce shopping cart capabilities or an event ticketing system. These links can be sent via SMS text messages, email or embedded into a website or social media site to present service or product details with the option for the viewer to purchase directly from the messages or posts. All this can be done without the need of an existing e-commerce site and can be set up in less than an hour.

   In developing the platform, special attention was given to the challenges of travel agents and agencies and the nature of collecting on customized pricing for services and products that usually don’t fit the cookie cutter approach to traditional off the shelf e-commerce platforms. With NTC ePay businesses can present specialized offerings with add-ons and deductions in a simple, intuitive interface.

Michael is Managing Director of Cross Keys Capital, a leading Investment banking firm. As a seasoned executive-entrepreneur having significant experience owning, operating, and exiting several businesses over the last 35 years, Michael now leads sell-side representations for lower and middle market companies typically ranging in revenues from $10 million to $150 million with EBITDA from $2 million to $20 million. Michael advises owner-founders, executives, entrepreneurs, and family-owned businesses by identifying and optimizing well planned exits, recapitalizations, and divestitures often part of succession planning, retirement, partner separations, and unplanned life events. 

One of Michael’s favorite messages he wishes to convey to all prospective sellers is “I would rather meet you three-to-five years out from your exit then in the same year you plan to sell.”

column69:

Founded in 2002, Cross Keys Capital is a leading middle market investment bank focused on delivering maximum value for its clients. Headquartered in Fort Lauderdale, FL, and with a team of 23 professionals, Cross Keys provides its clients with a full suite of investment banking advisory services including sell-side and buy-side M&A, capital raises, recapitalizations and restructurings. Operating within a national framework, Cross Keys has executed more transactions than any other independent investment bank in Florida over the last ten years. The firm has expertise across a variety of industries including healthcare, business services, manufacturing, logistics and TMT.

column200:
Today's commodity markets are extremely volatile.  Everything from weather patterns and supply disruptions to geopolitical and economic concerns can move prices quickly. The role of our group is to help mitigate risk for our customers that have heavy exposure to price changes in commodities; specifically energy, base metals and precious metals.  Our team works with both producers and consumers of these products to hedge their risk associated with changing prices.  We provide research and recommendations on specific ways to achieve the goals of our customers including meeting budgets, locking in margins or achieving a known cost structure.  
Our Capital Markets group as a whole provides several other ways to mitigate risk whether it's associated with interest rate changes, foreign exchange rates or market exposure.  Our group brings a wealth of knowledge and experience to our customers to help them achieve the goals they've set.

column1:
Call or text me ☎️ +1 (954) 257-5666
Email me 📩 drew@localitybank.com 

Drew Saito is Co-Founder and Chief Lending Officer at Locality Bank. He has 20+ years of banking and financial services experience in South Florida.  Drew's primary focus has been in commercial banking, real estate lending and treasury management.  Drew was formerly an adjunct faculty member at The Huizenga School of Business and Entrepreneurship at Nova Southeastern University. 

Drew earned a B.S. in Finance and B.S. in International Business from Florida State University, MBA from Nova Southeastern University and attended the Graduate School of Banking at the University of Wisconsin - Madison.  Most recently, Drew completed the GABV Leadership Academy at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology - CoLab.

Drew currently serves on the Board of Directors at Women's in Distress and Board of Governors at the Lauderdale Yacht Club.   Drew's previous governance experience includes: vice chair on the City of Fort Lauderdale's Budget Advisory Board,  Development Chair for the United Way of Broward County, served on the board of Broward Housing Solutions, the Crockett Foundation and appointed to the Broward Housing Council.  Additionally, Drew has previously served on the board of NAIOP, the board of trustees for the Morikami Museum, the Urban Land Institute's District Council Executive Committee (SE Florida/Caribbean), was a founding member of the Broward Center of Performing Art's Ghost Light Society and a member of Leadership Broward's Class 28.

column436:
What makes Bill a rare leader and a such a pleasure to work with is his ability to provide both executive leadership and tactical guidance that focuses on innovation, member experience, team success and bottom line results. What separates Bill form so many is his ability to forge both a short-term, results-generating action plan AND provide the long-term vision necessary to insure a successful future.

He provides a data-based, fresh perspective on current products and promotions that simultaneously build the balance sheet and make member financial lives better.

I had the pleasure of working with Bill for over a year at UNCLE Credit Union as a member of the executive leadership team where we collaborated, brainstormed and constantly looked for ways to meet the challenges that marketing, lending and the credit union faced. 

William joined the team at UNCLE during an unprecedented time (COVID-19) yet still managed to effectively move the lending discipline and the credit union forward. With calm leadership he quickly assessed the existing situation and positively crafted new paths forward for lending products including HELOCs, Credit Cards, and PPP loans. 

He created a close partnership between marketing and lending and was a champion of using data to help marketing provide relevant lending products, offerings and campaigns.

He has an infectious positive attitude that opens up a room and helps the team focus on meeting member needs and creating credit union results. Working with Bill was a delight.

At Axiom Bank, N.A., we have attracted thirty new thought leaders in technology, operations, finance and business development to drive the formation and execution of our transformative strategy.  Our shareholders provide the intellectual and financial capital to make our vision a reality, and our Board has been augmented with industry leaders in fintech, private equity, risk and compliance to provide guidance, oversight and governance.

Axiom Bank, N.A. has a rich history of financial inclusion that we are expanding to support a broader universe of consumers, commercial clients and fintechs.  Our vision and solutions embrace technology and innovation, focusing on solving problems to create distinctive customer journeys.

Our sustainable growth is supported by a portfolio of complementary businesses that generate outsized returns enabling us to reinvest in our people, platform and communities.  Our open technology architecture allows for building customized solutions powered by our fintech partnerships.

Mortgage executive with a demonstrated experience of working in mortgage banking processes, technology development, business management, marketing, sales, vendor and procurement management, public relations, social media, Hispanic/International marketing and book publishing. 

Entrepreneur, innovative, decision maker, creative, leader, intuitive, objective, relationship builder, committed, adaptable, and learner for life. 

I co-lead QC Verify, LLC and the wonderful team that make it a great place to be. 
 
QC Verify Mastermind.

QC Verify is a well-established leader and outsource provider of audits, QC software, verification solutions and fulfillment processes to mortgage lenders, banking institutions, credit unions and financial industries across the nation.
 
Since our founding in January 1999, the company has blazed the trail as the mortgage industry transitioned from paper to digital documentation and we continue to do so today in an ever-changing industry.
 
We are the creators of the QC Verify verification process: a revolutionary breakthrough in verification development automation. Our MARS QC software is second to none and provides user-friendly, first-class portals and processes to our clients.  QC Verify provides Fannie Mae, Freddie Mac, FHA, VA, USDA and portfolio Post-Closing, Pre-Purchase, Pre-Funding, Servicing, MERS®, Closing Due Diligence, Antimoney Laundering, HMDA, Desk Reviews, and other custom audits to clients nationwide. In addition, we provide fulfillment services designed to add cost saving efficiencies to companies in various industries.
www.qcverify.com

column85:
QMS is a boutique firm provider of audits and technology solutions to the mortgage banking industry. From overseeing the company operations, to managing the company's marketing, contracts, and sales efforts, my job is to make sure that we meet our revenue goals while keeping our operational costs and overhead low. 

Our company mission is always geared towards exceeding our clients' expectations while providing great customer service and analytical reports. Under my umbrella are also all fiscal responsibilities for the company while maintaining a culture of employee satisfaction and good team morale.

I assist our clients with developing internal QC guidelines and methodologies to comply with investor and agency requirements. Under my leadership, our team developed a portal solution to improve the verification process required as part of the audits. 

In essence, I wear many hats in the company which allow me the opportunity to grow and understand what it takes to run a company. Currently working towards the role of company President.

QMiS Systems is a subsidiary of Quality Mortgage Services (QMS), a U.S. based company specializing in mortgage compliance and quality assurance audits and reviews. 

QMiS currently provides back office support to the mortgage banking industry with processes such as data entry, loan processing, file indexing, pre-funding quality control and more. column1:
As the Head of Treasury at SellersFi, I lead the treasury digital transformation to enable SellersFi business drivers, by designing and implementing cash and liquidity management infrastructure to bank partners and SellersFi loan management system. 

Previously as the VP for Digital Payments and Operations, I streamlined and integrated SellersFi operations processes and controls, preparing the company backoffice to support the rapid business expansion.

As the CTO for Safrapay expansion to the USA, I oversaw the 100% cloud based Bank Acquirer (Base24-eps, CMM, uP Framework, PRM) (Azure), Digital Banking (Jack Henry Associates - AS400) and Card Issuing (FIS - zOS) implementation and integration, managing more than 150 professionals, distributed in Brazil, USA, and Europe, while negotiated and managed large vendors such as IBM, ACI, Accenture, Microsoft, Oracle, Salesforce, among others.

At ACI Brazil, I managed key accounts business development and project implementation, including First Data, Safrapay and Banco Itau. In 2018, I was awarded the ACI President's Club Award for Banco Safra card acquirer implementation in Brazil, which involved ACI product customization for ISO-8583BR and the Brazilian clearing house standards and regulations.

In my last 3 years at IBM I managed the two largest contracts for IBM Latin America (Two of the top 20 IBM contracts in the world), for Banco Itau and Banco Bradesco, to deploy the hardware (high-end servers, mainframe, storage, networking solutions), software and services infrastructure required to support the digital transformation in the two largest private banks in Brazil.

I have large experience with Software Development Management, and led several Software Process Improvement Projects at IBM/Rational Software, in different industries including Banks (Itau BBA,Bradesco),Telecom (Ericsson, Nortel, Motorola, Embratel, Oi), Aerospace (Embraer, INPE, Lockheed Martin) and Defense (Brazilian Air Force, Brazilian Navy).

column444: I had the honor of working with Mauro Assano, right after my return to IBM, when he was managing the construction of the IBM Client Center São Paulo. Since the moment we met, I was taken aback with the responsibility, determination and sheer competence with which he handled the wide variety of challenges that he encountered - from civil engineering problems to budget issues. Always resorting to his privileged mind, trained by the best schools in Brazil, including ITA (Air Force Institute of Technology), arguably one of Brazil's best. Event after he moved to another department, we would meet, from time-to-time, when I had the chance to be informed of his latest accomplishments in his endeavors, including the predictive model that he created for a client that solved what was, at the time, a intractable budget planning problem.  Later on, we would meet again, when Mauro was into IoT for buildings, an area that he, again, quickly mastered, as he had done multiple times in the past.  In light of such track record, I can very comfortably say that any company would be lucky to have Mauro in its staff, for positions that require leader that not only thinks, but also gets things done.

column641:
Small Business Administrator Isabella Guzman warned on Tuesday that minority-owned small businesses’ lack of access to capital is costing the U.S. economy hundreds of billions of dollars in economic output.

In an interview with The Hill, Guzman cited an Aspen Institute study that found that lack of investment in Latino-owned small businesses is contributing to a $900 billion marketplace inefficiency. Correcting that marketplace inefficiency, according to the research, would also produce around 4.2 million jobs.

Small-Business are responsible for about 46% of the US GDP and 48% of total employment. Small-Business also play an important role to financial independence of minorities groups in the US. 
However, not only minorities, but a significant share of Small-Business has limited access or no access at all to Credit sources. 
That’s why FINTECs as SellersFunding are of National Importamce to the United States, by enabling access to credit and nurturing Small-Business to growth! 

If you have a eCommerce business, and find yourself, looking for viable ways to grow, reach out to SellersFunding and we will help you!

#Sellersfunding #SmallBuisiness #Economy #SBA

With over 23 years of experience in the banking industry, I am a seasoned leader in information technology and operations, with a proven track record of delivering results and driving innovation. As the Senior Vice President - Chief Technology & Operations Officer at Lee Bank, I direct the activities of the Information Technology, Deposit Operations, Data Management, Card Services, Consumer Electronic Banking, Business Online, Merchant Services, and Retail Operations teams and manage the bank's information security, business continuity, enterprise risk management, and vendor management programs.

My core competencies include process improvement, network administration, digital transformation, and customer relationship management. I have successfully led the technical aspects of a critical banking core conversion, developed and executed the bank's digital strategic plan, and implemented new strategic products and services to enhance customer satisfaction and retention. My mission is to leverage new technologies to support the bank's strategic objectives, increase operational efficiencies, reduce costs, and comply with the changing regulatory environment.
column69:
Direct the activities of the Deposit Operations, Retail Operations, Business & Consumer Electronic Banking, and Information Technology departments and maintained business plans to ensure they are coordinated and focused to support the needs of the Bank.
Manage the Banks Business Continuity, Enterprise Risk Management, and Vendor Management programs with participation from department stakeholders.
Promote and oversee strategic relationships between internal IT and operational resources and external entities, including government, vendors, core processors, fintech, and partner organizations.
Chair of the Tactical Technical Steering Committee, a committee comprised of end-users and management from all departments.
Serve as the Bank’s Chief Information Security Officer and manage enterprise-wide security policies and procedures, develop, implement, and monitor long-term information security and cybersecurity strategy. Including compliance with FDIC, OCC, State, and FFIEC requirements.
Develop digital workflows integration into CRM platforms.

Measure, monitor, and update or sunset existing products and services as appropriate and review new digital channels as a way to retain customers and drive new revenue.

column1:
Nearly two decades of specializing in both business valuation and M&A, I am proud to contribute to Northeast Florida to Savannah, Georgia and beyond with my expertise in valuation, business strategy, and transaction advisory.

Deeply rooted in Jacksonville, Florida, I have developed close referral partnerships with transaction attorneys, lawyers specializing in: litigation, family law, estate and Tax, CPAs, and financial advisors (CFAs). We work together to provide outstanding services to owners of privately held companies, who view me as their trusted friend and growth partner. 

My firm focuses on B2B, manufacturing,  transportation and logistics, healthcare and metals. As a member of Oaklins, we are one of the largest lower middle market investment banks in the world. We have broad reach in every industry segment.  

Valuation:  No size too big or small - my company’s independent appraisals are relied upon by business owners, executives, accountants and attorneys to support estate and tax planning, financial reporting, purchases or sales of companies, or complex litigation. With M&A expertise, I inform our valuation work with real market feedback.  

M&A:  Fiercely representing business owners is part of my brand DNA, in growth, sale, or exit.
I build strong relationships with my clients. I take time to understand my clients’ unique needs, desires, and wants to design a transaction process to meet their goals.

Even though my primary focus is on maximizing the seller’s interest, I am honored to have been recommended by private equity and other buyers to represent business sellers from whom they want to buy. It is in everyone’s best interest to have expertly executed and fair transactions on all sides.

I hold a Series 24, 79 and 63 license from FINRA for investment banking activities and I am also a licensed real estate broker for the state of Florida. 

Working with entrepreneurs to realize the value of what they created is my passion, in growth, valuation, and exit.

I love music and play guitar, piano, and harmonica.  I also enjoy reading about a variety of topics: Economics, weather, history, politics, and learning about people and their special talents. 
My wife of 20 years and I are raising our boys in Jacksonville where we are both active volunteers in the community.

column69:
Through my advisory experience and through owning businesses, I understand the challenges owners face. I want to make their lives better. I help business owners realize the value of what they spent their lives building! Consequently, I connect business builders to their dreams and to a better family life. This gives me the most satisfaction.

I love solving problems for my clients, big or small. Knowing that they call me for help is very rewarding and getting the right answers for them is extremely gratifying.

I value strong ethical relationships built on trust.

I look out for my clients' best interests, and sometimes that requires me not just telling them what they want to hear, but rather what they need to hear. Since I am in the trenches with business owners, I fiercely fight for the best deal possible. We both win by optimizing their best interests, with my experience and expertise in growing or selling their business.

column461: I've been working with Lisa for nearly four months. In that time, she's changed my life, both professionally and personally. I typically manage 10 to 15 active client projects at any given time in addition to making time to market my company's services. Prior to meeting Lisa I didn't have the time to plan and, as a result, lived in constant fire fighting mode. I tried many techniques and tools but had not enlisted the services of a professional to help me. Lisa's approach is flexible enough to find the tools and techniques that work for me and fit my personality. As a result, I've been able to accomplish more in "less time", get out of fire fighting mode, and carefully plan my time in advance. I'd recommend Lisa to anyone in any profession.

column1:
Results-Driven Executive | Business Builder | Relentless Problem-Solver

Business is war, and I play to win. I’ve built, scaled, and optimized companies across fintech, SaaS, and financial services, delivering real, measurable results. I don’t waste time on theory—I execute. My expertise spans revenue growth, operational efficiency, customer acquisition, and cutting-edge technology integration. If there’s a way to make a business more profitable, I’ll find it.

I’ve led organizations through rapid expansion, streamlined complex financial structures, and turned inefficiencies into cash flow. Scaling businesses isn’t just about working hard—it’s about making the right decisions at the right time. That’s where I thrive. I know how to optimize sales, implement automation, and structure deals that drive long-term success.

I don’t believe in excuses—only results. Whether it’s launching high-growth ventures, negotiating strategic partnerships, or leading teams to peak performance, I focus on one thing: value creation. If you’re serious about scaling your business and driving profitability, let’s talk.
column69:
BellaStrada Ventures, LLC| Strategic Growth Partners

At BellaStrada Ventures, LLC, we are more than advisors—we are builders, connectors, and catalysts for growth.

BellaStrada Ventures, LLC brings together deep expertise across capital markets, private equity, operations, and technology. We partner with corporate and private companies to unlock opportunity, accelerate execution, and scale with confidence.

We specialize in:
- Strategic advisory for rapid growth and market expansion

- Capital raises with PE firms, venture funds, and family offices

- M&A positioning, fundraising roadmaps, and investor relations

- High-impact connections across industries and influence circles

BellaStrada Ventures, LLC exists to bridge vision with execution—connecting people, capital, and strategy to create exponential outcomes. Whether you're raising your first round or ready to scale globally, we help pave the way.

Let’s build something extraordinary together.

Disfruto trabajando en proyectos complejos, desde el análisis hasta el desarrollo, ya sea de forma independiente o como parte de un equipo.

Mi formación profesional, en adición a mi inquietud por adquirir nuevas habilidades, me permite adaptarme fácilmente a nuevos lenguajes de programación y flujos de trabajo.
Apasionado por mi trabajo, creativo y resolutivo por naturaleza, estoy interesado en mejorar cada día y desarrollar proyectos innovadores en un entorno internacional.

Over the last two decades, I’ve used strategic M&A to scale and transform middle-market companies. Now I advise founders using the same playbook that worked for me.

I’m industry-agnostic, with expertise spanning franchising, multi-unit retail, luxury hospitality, and business services. My approach combines process-driven execution and strategic acquisitions to maximize business options and unlock long-term enterprise value.

The Framework is Simple: Optimize, Transform, Ascend.

Relevant Experience:

 → Managing Director, Merger Partners Inc. – A boutique investment bank specializing in middle-market M&A, executing the proprietary Sniper Process®.
 → Owner, The Owl’s Cove – A luxury short-term rental property in Estes Park, CO.
 → Orangetheory Fitness Multi-Unit Area Developer & Owner. – Built and exited a high-growth franchise business in Missouri.
 → CEO, HCOA Fitness – Led a family office-backed restructuring, turning around a distressed gym chain acquired out of Chapter 11, culminating in a successful PE-backed sale.

My Toolkit:

 → Mergers & Acquisitions Strategy – Structuring high-value exits and strategic acquisitions.
 → Business Turnarounds & Exits – Revitalizing distressed assets and positioning for premium valuations.
 → Operational & Financial Optimization – Driving profitability, efficiency, and sustainable growth.
 → High-Impact Leadership Development – Building and coaching elite executive teams that deliver results.

Stay Connected:
Follow me for insights on scaling, optimizing, and exiting businesses.

📩 Coming soon: Night Eagle Strategies—a newsletter diving deep into M&A, business growth, and value creation.

Let’s connect to discuss how I can help you optimize, scale, or position your business for a high-value exit.

📧 Email: juanortega@mergerpartners.com
Follow me on X: @juan_ortega

column139:
I owned development rights of this fitness company in Missouri, opening the first location in 2016 and adding another sub-franchisee, doubling the market in just a few months. 

In this role, I managed to grow business from 2 to 19 locations in 2019 and acquired 2 of the existing sub-franchisee locations in 2019, personally overseeing 5 owned locations and 14 sub-franchised locations  demonstrating massive growth in 4 years. 

The business slowed down significantly throughout COVID, but established an effective pandemic operating plan. 

I continually managed the business throughout the COVID pandemic, navigating challenges to re-open the locations and rebuild memberships, which eventually concluded in successful negotiation of profitable sale at a high multiple in September 2021 to an Atlanta based Private Equity group.

Key Areas of Expertise:

Territory Development | Strategic Direction | Mergers & Acquisitions Oversight | Operational Leadership | Performance Management | Fiscal Oversight | Leadership Coordination | Cross-Functional Collaboration
column169:
I assumed the CEO position in this company, overseeing and directing fitness company’s overall operations. 

In addition, I managed to grow business into a multi-unit, full service Health Club Company, with 25,000 customers and 600 employees in 18 locations in Miami and Puerto Rico. 

Moreover, I led and managed acquisition of the Lady of America Franchisor on December 2011, taking full control of the HCOA unisex brand. 

Lastly, I removed franchising rights of clubs in December 2013 prior to the sale of the HCOA Fitness operation.

Among my Notable Highlights & Contributions, I:

- Developed strategic restructuring plan after company’s acquisition out of Chapter 11 in October 2009, resulting to sale of 75% of the equity to a New York Private Equity group in December 2013 and securing an equity return of 1,200%. I also executed post-sale agreements to facilitate smooth transition of business to new ownership group.

- Created a new system to effectively manage sales force, achieving 15% increase in revenue in the first 12 months. I reduced maintenance costs and increased EBITDA by 15% through the development of weekly cash flow management reports prioritizing capital investments across various facilities.

- Oversaw all aspects of the $1M health club facility project in Hato Rey, Puerto Rico, generating an incremental cash flow of 21%. The facility became a showcase model for the new HCOA brand in Puerto Rico.

- Saved $1 million in annual operating cost by renegotiating partnership agreements and real estate leases. I also acquired the third party Personal Training service in August 2012 and integrated operations into own facilities, doubling EBITDA.

column626:
The day the deal closed, I didn’t celebrate.

We had sold our Orangetheory territory to a private equity group with a major platform.  As an add-on, there was no expectation for me to stay on, and truthfully, I had structured it that way. I wanted a complete exit—no lingering ties, no transitional role, just a clean break.

But when it happened, the quiet caught me off guard.

There were no more team calls to prep for, no leadership updates to review, no sense of momentum pulling me forward.

Just stillness.

The kind of stillness that feels foreign when you've been in motion for a decade.

In that silence, I began to realize just how much of my identity had been built around urgency.  Around being needed.  Around having somewhere to be, someone to lead, and benchmarks to surpass.

I didn't miss the stress, but I did miss the presence—the daily rhythm, the unspoken camaraderie, the feeling that I was part of something alive.

When that structure fell away, what was left was space.  And space is not always comfortable.

So I stepped back.

I gave myself time, not for a sabbatical or some curated reinvention, but for something simpler.

To sit with my family without distraction. 
To be around my kids without rushing off. 
To ask questions I hadn't had time to consider in years.

Naturally, people started reaching out.

"Are you planning to take another CEO job?" 
"Will you be launching something new?" 
"Is there a franchise you're looking at acquiring?"

I understood why they asked.  But I didn't feel the pull.  Not yet.  I wasn't looking to fill the space just to avoid it.

Eventually, I needed a project—something tangible, something real.  I bought a mountain property in Colorado.

I renovated it and turned it into a short-term rental.

It wasn't some master plan.  It was just a project I could do in peace, without pressure.  It was something I could finish without needing it to be the next big thing.

During those months, I wasn't building a new business.  I was rebuilding clarity.
I wasn't preparing a plan.  I was asking questions I hadn't had space to ask in years.

Who am I without being needed every day? 
What do I do when no one's waiting on me? 
Can I sit in the silence without trying to fill it?

The exit wasn't a mistake…
It was a reckoning.

And in the quiet that followed, I realized this:

A liquidity event isn't just about putting money in the bank.  It's an invitation—sometimes a disorienting one—to pause, to reflect, and to sit with the uneasy excitement of discovering what comes next.

Most founders chase the next thing to avoid the quiet.  I chose to embrace it.  That's where the real work began—finding purpose beyond achievement, writing the first lines of an authentic second act.
column641:
You sold the business—but you didn’t walk away.  You rolled equity, stayed on as CEO, and now you're leading a PE-backed platform.

Your mandate is to grow the core, do bolt on acquisitions, and scale toward a second exit.

But here’s where founders run into trouble:

The pace of dealmaking cannot outpace the platform goals.

When I was running HCOA, one of our bolt-on acquisitions doubled EBITDA.  But it took two full years to integrate—aligning culture, syncing financial systems, reworking incentives, and capturing real synergies.  We couldn’t afford to chase the next deal until we made that one work.

But once it was integrated, it gave us the foundation to absorb another add-on—and that set the stage for our exit.

Remember,  it’s not just about doing deals - it’s about making the deals stick.

Here’s what matters:

- Every acquisition needs a real integration plan before the LOI
- Cultural alignment isn’t optional—it’s foundational
- Incentives must roll up into platform-wide KPIs
- Financial systems and reporting have to be consistent
- Real synergies must be realized

You don’t grow just by buying—you grow by absorbing

If you’re in the seat post-transaction, act like it’s your capital on the line.

- Push for integration discipline.

- Stay close to the financials.

- Don’t chase new deals until the foundation is solid.

That’s how real platform value gets built—and exits get earned.

🔁 Follow for more insights on founder alignment, capital-backed growth, and building businesses that scale with clarity.
column654:
You’ve built a franchise. But would you buy it?

That’s the real question—because buyers don’t just care how many units you’ve sold. They want to know if the system can thrive without you.

In most franchise deals, the cracks don’t show up at the core. They show up at the edges.

Too often, brands expand before they stabilize—bringing in the wrong operators, chasing momentum, and neglecting consistency. That’s when value begins to erode.

If you're building toward an exit—or just want the option—here’s what actually matters:

1.) Solid unit-level economics

The benchmark is clear: 4-wall EBITDA margins should be north of 20%. No add-backs, no excuses. Buyers want each unit to stand on its own—consistently and profitably.

2.) Territory structure that creates leverage

Well-zoned development areas with future “relief” locations. Your territory map isn’t just a growth plan—it’s a strategic asset with clear white space.

3.) Development schedules that are aggressive—but achievable

Unrealistic timelines tank deals. Smart buyers want scale, but they also want discipline.

4.) A leadership team that keeps innovating

Concepts go stale fast. If your leadership isn’t evolving the brand, the market will leave it behind.

5.) Franchisees who build businesses—not buy jobs

You’re not just selling units, you’re building a network. If the operators aren’t strong, neither is your system.

6.) Support infrastructure that enforces consistency

A true support structure—real estate, field operations, onboarding, and brand standards—has to be in place. The system should operate consistently across markets, without relying on constant oversight.

7.) A functioning Franchise Advisory Council

Your FAC isn’t a formality. It’s a signal. Buyers see it as a proxy for trust, alignment, and operational health.

8.) Recognizable brand and sticky customer loyalty

Marketing matters—but only when it leads to retention. A franchise that customers return to is worth more than one they simply talk about.

I saw this firsthand at Orangetheory.

The franchisor didn’t just grow fast—they grew with discipline. They brought in strong operators, entered key markets ahead of the competition, invested in scalable infrastructure, and built a customer culture that lasted.

Between 2017 and 2021, M&A activity exploded.
Buyers weren’t just chasing a trend. They were pursuing a system that had the foundation and the leadership to keep growing.

That’s what “built to exit” really looks like.

So I’ll ask again:
Would you buy what you’re building?

 🔁 Like & Share if you found this insightful. Follow me for more on M&A, scaling, and maximizing value.

column1:
Scott Salpeter, president and co-founder of Cassel Salpeter & Co., uses his background in finance and accounting and his meticulous, pragmatic, straightforward style to help the firm’s clients achieve their goals.

Over the years, Scott has successfully structured and negotiated an extensive array of deals and executed numerous M&A transactions for clients in the U.S. and worldwide. As a credentialed valuation professional, Scott has handled more than 350 fairness opinions, solvency opinions, valuations, and related assignments for a multitude of transactions in varied industries.

Prior to establishing Cassel Salpeter, Scott was a co-founder and served as managing director of Capitalink, where he worked alongside his partner and longtime friend, James Cassel. When Capitalink was acquired by Ladenburg Thalmann, Scott continued there as managing director in its investment banking department.

In addition to his work in investment banking, Scott served as Chief Financial Officer for three publicly held corporations and has served on the board of directors of several public and private companies. Scott is a Certified Valuation Analyst.

Scott earned his bachelor’s degree in commerce in 1981 from Washington and Lee University, in Lexington, VA.

Carrie Rinehart-Bekker is an Entrepreneur and Founder/CEO of Bekker Compliance Consulting Partners, LLC (BCCP), a boutique consultancy that provides the following cross-border solutions to our esteemed clients in North America, Southeast Asia, Europe, Middle East, Caribbean, and other regions worldwide:

•	Compliance Consulting
•	Legal/Compliance Recruiting
•	Expert Witness
•	Training

Ms. Bekker is a compliance expert with 41 years’ legal and regulatory compliance experience derived from her tenure as a Paralegal/Legal Executive in law firms, corporate law departments, and trust companies throughout the United States and internationally.  Before founding BCCP, Ms. Bekker also served as an AML and Senior Compliance Officer with several global financial conglomerates, including AEGON/Transamerica, Pacific Life Insurance Company, and AIG Sunamerica.  

Please visit our website at www.bccp-llc.com for details about the niche cross-border consulting and training services that our International Experts provide to our financial and legal clients.

column38:
Class of 1981 -- Graduated, cum laude

My major was SPC's degreed fledgling paralegal program.  The comprehensive curriculum included substantive law (litigation, real estate, corporate, transactional, probate), the "how to" nuts-and-bolts of the legal processes pertaining to each areas of the law, legal research and writing, business communications (business writing, speech writing and delivery), technical aspects (early 80s technology -- word processing, for example), mathematics, accounting, business law, business fundamentals, political science, client relations, law firm protocol, and much more.

I was also a member of Phi Theta Kappa.
column40: Associate’s Degree, International Law and Legal Studies
column69:
In 2006, after my tenure as Director of Variable Annuity Compliance with AIG Sunamerica, I founded and launched Bekker Compliance Consulting Partners, LLC (BCCP), a full-service global consulting, training, and expert witness firm that provides practical, how-to style services to financial institutions, financial services firms, law firms, and training institutes in the US, Europe, Middle East, Southeast Asia, and other regions worldwide.

BCCP is also actively engaged in global financial sector modernization, private sector development, and public sector reform -- providing technical assistance and training worldwide.

BCCP delivers interactive global training workshops through Bekker Compliance Institute (BCI), our Training Division.  We design each of our customized, how-to training workshops utilizing a unique combination of lecture, roundtable discussion, and practical exercises with case studies, taking into account international best practices, as well as country and regional considerations depending on where and to whom the training is being delivered.

Corporate, securities, and Blue Sky compliance and regulatory filings for Capital Markets partner in SanDiego, CA office. Responsibilities included legal research, entity formation, foreign qualification, lien searches, and SEC and Blue Sky compliance for Delaware Statutory Trusts (DSTs), REITs, and open and closed-end funds.  Handled entity formation, foreign qualification, and corporate governance matters for DSTs, REITs, and hedge funds.  Drafted Form SS-4s, Form IDs, Form Ds, AML/KYC related documents, and made SEC and Blue Sky filings on EDGAR, EFD, and state websites. 
 I also handled Blue Sky research matters in connection with DST, REITs, and other open-ended private funds.  I created a detailed matrix to track Form 99 filings for approximately 55 issuers for eventual filing with the New York Department of Real Estate Finance, which also included tracking down and compiling all documents needed to make such filings once the portal opens. I also designed and delivered an intensive four-week, how-to training program on SEC and Blue Sky compliance to approximately 20 case assistants and mid-level and senior paralegals. I served as a resource to fellow paralegals within the firm nationwide for advice and guidance on corporate and SEC/Blue Sky research and filings.

A J-shaped hanger clip defines a long leg extendable into the tank interior and a short leg extendable into the filter housing interior. Bolting is engageable through the short leg for bringing the wall of the tank and confronting wall of the filter housing into tightenable clamping position relative to each other. In the filter housing is an upper seat for upwardly supporting a splash box having an apertured bottom wall for water drainage and a filter compartment therebelow filled with a biological fiber wool for the filtering of the water charged thereinto and a return hose and complementary motorized pump for the return of the filtered water from the filter housing to the aquarium tank.
column424:
Common SEO Mistakes: Basic Edition has 25 of the most basic common SEO mistakes that people make over and over again. It is easier to understand SEO by knowing what the mistakes are and avoiding them rather than learning SEO techniques that are no longer valid.
SEO techniques are constantly changing and it can be dangerous to use techniques from an old book. What rarely changes in the SEO space are the mistakes! Common SEO Mistakes: Basic Edition is a compilation of the 25 Basic Search Engine Optimization Mistakes That Can Kill Your Business!
This book is designed to help you understand the importance of avoiding SEO mistakes. Search Engine Optimization is a tricky subject and I decided to take a different approach with this book than a lot of the books that are out there. This is because sometimes you need to know what you are doing wrong first before you can understand how to fix it. The challenge with a lot of the SEO books is they try to teach you what SEO is and then let you go and do it. For many this can help them up to a certain level and then hurt them as time goes on. This is because SEO is always changing so the good techniques that are learned from a book that was written a month ago could be bad techniques today. However, the one thing that rarely changes are the SEO Mistakes.
This book came about because I am always answering questions from clients, prospective clients, colleagues and friends. I felt like I was constantly repeating myself because over time the same answers kept coming up. Clearly there are a lot of common SEO mistakes out there that need to be addressed.
I set out to write them down and today am still writing because I continually see new mistakes taking shape. This will be a never ending battle because of the way the search engines work. As the public gets close to deciphering the algorithms it becomes easier and easier to get on the top search results pages. Read More . . .
column427: Common SEO Mistakes: Basic Edition

WHAT WE DO: 

Assist Business owners in the confidential sale of their businesses from California to Florida and Coast to Coast.  

OUR PROCESS:

We develop a value report using our internal platform, followed by a multipage Confidential Business Memorandum that includes industry intelligence.  We develop a positioning Teaser Ad (without specifics) that we post on multiple business for sale websites, including CrossRoadsBusiness.com. For larger deals we develop strategic Buyer and Private Equity targeting campaigns that target decision makers.  We screen potential buyers that respond to our ads and strategic Buyer outreach and keep track of all interactions via an integrated state-of-the-art Deal Management system.  We assist the owner in all aspects of the deal process through closing.

OUR SPECIALTIES:

🔳 Manufacturing
🔳 Distribution
🔳 Healthcare Services & Practices
🔳 Specialty Contracting
🔳 Services
🔳 Multitude of other industries 

SERVICES OFFERED:

🔳 Business sales
🔳 Mergers & Acquisitions
🔳 Business Valuations
🔳 Franchise resales & Consulting


ABOUT CROSSROADS

CrossRoads is a full service Business Brokerage and M&A firm that delivers outstanding results to our Sellers.

The price the business will end up selling for is heavily influenced by not only how effectively the business is packaged, positioned, and negotiated with prospective Buyers, but as importantly, how effectively we can create competition amongst multiple interested parties.  Value perception helps our goal of maximizing the selling price and reaching your objectives. 

WHAT OTHERS' HAVE SAID:

“We interviewed 16 certified M&A agencies and narrowed the field to four finalists including one who had won national titles. Crossroads stood out from the start because of their superior organization, thoroughness of protocols, and above all being communicative. Even-though there were nearly 70 interested inquiries, we only needed to spend time with the three best prospects, while Crossroads screened the remainder on its own. Within five months, the offer was 4% higher than our listed price. Tim Hatamian, CEO, PLEMCo”

Click to see more testimonials from our satisfied clients: https://crossroadsbusiness.com/testimonials

CONTACT INFO:

☎️ 888-854-1249   (office)
☎️ 321-960-1320  (cell)
💻 www.CrossRoadsBusiness.com
✏️ mjb@crossroadsbusiness.com

With 25 years of relative experience, and a veteran, I am hands-on leader of technology initiatives and cross-functional roles for private equity/M&A,  and public sector (government) crisis management. The following are noted accomplishments that pioneered the CIO role and created substantial value for stakeholders:
-	Supported management of companies when driving rapid growth and profit improvement through operational and strategic technology changes, with a particular focus on eCommerce/Omni-channel, AI open data algo solutions in order to capture price and customer advantages in the market. 
 -       Advised several boards of directors, government officials, and served in interim positions for numerous private equity-oriented situations. I was a frequent guest speaker to private equity firms on the effective use and competitive advantages of technology, mostly recently on large data AI to impact the value chain in PE portfolio companies and funds themselves. 
-	Started a firm, that became well referenced in the private equity community for value creation and interim-CIO roles, leveraging next generation cloud architecture, data intelligence, and ERP optimization
-	Expanded solution-base with growing understanding of fabric/AI solutions, automated development of operational data to support management decisions, and logic for market pricing. 
-	Worked closely with funds (internally) for development of deal thesis and transaction mandates; especially in carve-outs and merger integration (roll-up) positions. 
-	Spent the post-covid timeframe as a volunteer with the Red Cross disaster cycle services and a personal charity. Obtained FEMA crisis management certification and other disaster training.

Dynamic and accomplished leader with a unique blend of professional and public service experience, seamlessly balancing roles as an elected official, development executive, and consultant. Recognized as a catalyst for organizational growth, a trusted advisor in high-stakes environments, and a connector who brings stakeholders together to tackle challenges and seize opportunities. Adept at driving strategic development and fostering collaboration across governance, civic engagement, business development, and philanthropy.

Highlights include:

Business Development & Philanthropy: Delivering measurable results by securing multimillion-dollar funding for transformative projects in infrastructure, education, and transportation. Designing and implementing forward-thinking strategies to support long-term growth and development.

Governance & Leadership: Successfully presiding over complex meetings, ensuring transparency, civility, and alignment with parliamentary procedures. Proven record of advancing informed public policy, sustainable development, and economic growth while fostering community-driven progress.

Mentorship & Organizational Advancement: Mentoring emerging leaders, spearheading strategic plans, and championing collaborative leadership practices. Certified in nonprofit leadership and management, succession planning, and organizational performance, with demonstrated success enhancing both public and private sector initiatives.

Whether driving organizational success in the private sector or guiding high-impact decisions as an elected official, I am passionate about creating meaningful opportunities, cultivating relationships with key stakeholders, and addressing challenges with innovative solutions. My mission is to inspire and empower organizations and individuals to excel, thrive, and forge meaningful connections that drive lasting success.

31 Years of Love and Partnership! 

Taking a moment to reflect on an incredible journey that began before our wedding 31 years ago. Michael Reed and I have built a beautiful life together, filled with love, adventure, and achievements. 

We are proud parents of two amazing children who inspire us every day. Watching them grow into their own remarkable adults has been one of our greatest joys.

Together, we've ventured into the world of entrepreneurship, co-founding five private companies and two nonprofits. Each endeavor has taught us invaluable lessons about resilience, teamwork, and the impact we can make when we align our passions with purpose.

Now, we are thrilled to be working together once again with the unparalleled team at Republic Capital Group where we can combine our strengths and shared vision with their purpose to create even more positive change.

Here's to love, family, and the power of partnership! ❤️
Taylor R. & Dylan Reed 

#Anniversary #Love #Family #Teamwork #RepublicCapitalGroup

column69:
As a Senior Managing Director Steven leads Young America Capital’s Industrials, Chemicals and Manufacturing Sector Team focused on capital raises and buy-side/sell-side M&A.

Young America Capital is a New York-based FINRA/SEC-registered independent investment banking and advisory firm that provides capital raising, M&A advisory and fund marketing services for companies and alternative investment fund managers. Since its founding in 2010, YAC has completed more than 120 transactions and raised more than $1 billion for its clients. The firm is comprised of a diverse group of more than 65 senior investment bankers serving the following sectors: industrials, chemicals and manufacturing; consumer and retail; energy and clean-tech; financial services and fin-tech; life sciences and healthcare; telecom, media and technology; transportation; agriculture; real estate; legal cannabis and also has Latin America coverage.

column1:
Philip Cassel, a managing director at Cassel Salpeter & Co., uses his experience in consulting and private equity to contribute to the team and assist in all areas of the firm, from financial analysis to advisory services.

In his years with the firm, Philip has guided clients through M&A and capital raise transactions across a wide range of industries, including healthcare, consumer products and services, manufacturing, technology, and more.  He has worked with companies in both healthy and distressed situations, including assisting debtors through bankruptcy proceedings.

Prior to joining Cassel Salpeter, he worked for Rialto Capital, pioneering the finance group and assisting with the management of a real estate private equity fund. He has also worked at Alvarez & Marsal in the Turnaround and Restructuring Group, where he participated in restructuring projects in the telecommunications, mining, and manufacturing industries, including working onsite at the largest telecommunications company in the Virgin Islands. He handled cash flow modeling, budget planning, court filings, distressed M&A, and claims management. He also played an intricate role in the sale process of several entities and assisted with the investigation of potential fraud.

Philip earned a bachelor’s degree in mathematics from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, in Cambridge, MA.

column611:
WEBINAR: Beyond Borders – Unlocking U.S. Growth for European Healthcare & Life Sciences Companies and Investors, Thursday, July 24, 2025, 16:00 – 16:45 CET / 10:00 – 10:45 a.m. ET

For European Healthcare and Life Sciences (HCLS) companies and investors, the U.S. middle market offers an immense opportunity for strategic growth beyond U.S. product sales. 

This essential webinar provides European buyers with critical insights into leveraging currently attractive U.S. valuations, exploring how lower relative costs and unique capital access advantages can drive successful cross-border deals. 

Delve into the significant market scale and unparalleled growth opportunities, gaining guidance on navigating complex U.S. regulatory landscapes, including FDA, state laws, and data privacy. 

Discover how to effectively tap into the United States' renowned innovation and talent ecosystems through strategic acquisitions, with practical advice on talent retention and cultural integration. 

Finally, understand the evolving regulatory and policy alignment between the United States and Europe, equipping you with strategic advice to confidently navigate this dynamic investment environment. 

Join us to gain the competitive edge for your next U.S. HCLS acquisition.

Please click below link to register for the webinar.

https://lnkd.in/e_DDS7kR
column626:
U.S. Market Entry: Why The Current Climate Favors European Acquirers

This new thought leadership series—developed by leading M&A professionals from CBIZ [www.cbiz.com], Greenberg Traurig, LLP [www.gtlaw.com], NOBLE Capital Markets [https://lnkd.in/eYG2tHy9], and Pathfinder Advisors LLC [www.pathfinderadvisors.com]—explores the strategic, operational, and financial reasons why now is the prime time for transatlantic M&A across manufacturing, distribution, logistics, business services, and retail sectors.

● Attractive U.S. valuations and a resilient, growth-driven economy.
● A favorable policy environment combined with stable regulations and conducive M&A conditions.
● The imperative for strategic supply chain reconfiguration and greater operational flexibility driving enduring success.

This first installment, "Capitalizing on Change: Why Now Is the Right Time for European Enterprises to Acquire U.S. Companies," lays out the compelling business case, key market advantages, and regulatory shifts creating ripe conditions for European companies seeking U.S. acquisitions.

Read full article here: https://lnkd.in/ezJ2g2if

Please follow CBIZ, Greenberg Traurig, LLP, NOBLE Capital Markets, and Pathfinder Advisors LLC to be notified when additional articles in the series are available and for the details of an upcoming webinar panel with the authors.

As a highly accomplished sales leader, trainer, coach, and mentor with a proven track record of increasing team sales revenue by 50%, I love empowering sales teams to collaborate, generate new business, build relationships, and drive sales revenue. I am thrilled to offer my expertise.

AREA OF EXPERTISE
Sandler Sales System | Leader | Collaborator | Team Player | Educator | Coach and Mentor | Instructional Design | Micro Learning | Public Speaker | Facilitator | Training and Development | Territory Management | Project Management |Business Development | Sales Enablement | Marketing | Communication Catalyst | Relationship Development | Data Analysis | Competitive | Self Starter | Entrepreneur | Positive | Growth Oriented

Leadership@brianjwilhelm.com

My qualifications speak to my ability to lead, collaborate, educate, and coach teams. I bring proficiency in instructional design, micro-learning, public speaking, discussion facilitation, training and development, territory management, project management, business development, sales enablement, marketing, communication, relationship building, and data analysis to your organisation.

I am proud to hold multiple certifications, including a Certified John C. Maxwell Coach & Educator, Certified Sales Enablement Professional, Certified Buffini Sales System Trainer, and Facilitator, and an NMLS Mortgage License. Additionally, I hold a Bachelor of Arts Degree in Political Science from the University of North Carolina at Charlotte.

As a Fractional Sales Leader, I work with clients to develop their sales force and optimize their sales process increasing team-based revenue by 50%.  I have experience working with mid-size organizations and startups. 

At First Federal Bank, as a Residential Lending Sales and Systems Trainer, I created a 12-week Department of Defense SkillBridge program that trained veterans in Mortgage Lending Systems, Sales, Prospecting, and Referral Generation, resulting in an empowered and successful group of graduates. I also designed and implemented a compressed Three Day New Hire Training program that accelerated the onboarding process for Loan Originators and Account Executives, enabling them to drive sales and grow their businesses quickly.

In addition, I developed Micro-Learning E-Courses, using technology to deliver compliance and product knowledge in a convenient and accessible format.

Above all, I am committed to adding value to organizations and executive team leaders.

Please contact me to learn more
leadership@brianjwilhelm.com
